text: OMG! Saw a write up  in the paper about this place and went to check it out. Right as you walk in the door you know your in a good place because the smell makes you drool. Smells like a New York deli. I  had the Carter#16 cold, including all the ad on's  as suggested by many and they were right on!  Must try it on the Dutch Crunch roll. I could ony eat half. My husband had the Super NoVa #24 on the Dutch Crunch and said it was equally as good. Even though we do not live on the side of town, WE WILL BE BACK!!!! Super friendly staff as well. Good job guys!

With out question the GREATEST sandwich in the world. I travel to Las Vegas at least once a month for business and I come out of the way to eat here EVERY time. In the past few years I've lived in California, Michigan, and I currently live in Arizona. Simply nothing compares to this place. I've ordered the #16 every time this year. Hot turkey, cream cheese, bomb sauce, avocado, Dutch crunch bread.... The best

I've never had anything else, but everyone I bring here orders something different and they love it too!

this places sucks. that dutch crunch bread was stale, understandable since they ship it in i guess, but it seems that expense makes them skimp on the other stuff. interior was shabby, staff seemed engrossed in a discussion that i was interrupting. the 4.5 star rating is a scam, probably all the employees from all the other chains spamming 5 stars.

This place is awesome! There are so many different kinds of sandwiches! Try the bomb sauce it is so good! Service is excellent! Upon our first visit we had no idea what to order. The OWNER took the time to cut up some bread and pour each of the sauces into a ramekin so that we could try all the sauces to see which one we wanted on our sandwich. Since they had just opened, service is seamless, but they were still super friendly. This is the place to go! I can't wait to try all the different sandwiches.

Was there today. The service was great and everyone was extremely nice. The sandwiches? They were ok. If I go back I will not order anything that is hot as they use a microwave to melt the cheese into nothingness. The meat was good as were the sauces. I was so excited to try something new in the northwest, but was let down again. I suggest getting a toaster to run the bread through for the hot sandwiches. Will try again....
I hope this turns into a chain so that it comes closer. It is so good! Hospitality is great as well. It's always nice to eat a great sandwich made by someone who loves their job!
Had the turkey on the crunch munch bread no complaints ingredients was fresh price was right not bad.

I absolutely love this place . The bomb sauce is amazing an they psycho sauce is perfection. I've been here 4 times already an it just gets better every time I go in. They have great recommendations an a wonderful way of talking to you. Best sandwiches I have ever eaten.
Best sandwich place in Las Vegas not your standard sandwiches that everyone else has. Very unique twist on every sandwhich. Dutch crunch bread is a must.

This place is phenomenal! 

Taste like a local east coast deli. If your in the area do not miss an opportunity to feast on these delicious selections. If your not in the area...drive there.

I loved this place after a trying it the first time. I've went many times since they've opened but this last time was disappointing. After picking up my sandwich and got to work I was telling my boss all about how amazing and yummy this place was. I shared half of my sandwich with her to prove my point. Sandwich seemed fine while we were eating it but sadly both of us the next day were terribly sick to our stomachs. Both ends type of thing. Don't want to be to vulgar. I loved that place but after that I don't believe I'll be going there again. ):

This ain't your mama's sandwich place! Between all the different signature sandwiches to the sauces and beyond, it's ah-mazing! The atmosphere is awesome, the food is to die for and the staff is super sweet. If you've never been to The Sandwich Spot, you better run, walk, ride a bike or hitch a ride-- but get here. You will not be disappointed!

So today was my first visiting the sandwich shop. And I must say by far one of THE BEST sandwiches I have EVER had. I ordered "The Carter" named after one of the employees. Cool right? I wasn't too sure about cream cheese on a sandwich but it was incredibly delicious. I'm normally a mayo and mustard kind of girl but Mr. Carter himself suggested that leave off the mustard because it clashes. I did and added just a bit  to try at home. He was right really gross with the mustard. He asked me my name when I first got there and ended my time there by thanking me by first name when I left. INCREDIBLE customer service. They were cheerful and told me all about the shop while I was there. Where the art work came from and all. Such a cool laid back enviorment with DELICIOUS sandwiches I will definitely be back this week.

Yumm!  Ive been wanting to come here for a while now and finally convinced a co-worker to drive with me here from work.  Its certainly not the closest place to us but defenitly worth it.  Cant remember the name of my sandwich but I think it was the #7 pastrami and I added alfalfa sprouts (my favorite) on dutch bread.  He got the italian one on sourdough.  We both agreed that the sandwiches were fresh, the sauces were great and the place was well organized and clean.  The bread however did seem like a bit too much for my liking, the owner mentioned that if we went with their standard white or wheat that we may enjoy that more.  Either way, it wouldnt prevent me from coming back!  Good people and good sandwiches!  Come support a local small business that does it right!

Fabulous sandwiches, so good we had to try two! We had to go for the warm roast beef with cheddar on a worth the drive for Dutch Crunch roll, then backed it up with a turkey with cream cheese and avocado on another two snaps and a hair flip Dutch Crunch roll! The place is small but very clean, located in a shopping center. You have to be looking for it.

The food is good. We have been 3 times now and will probably not return again. 3/3 times our sandwiches have been wrong. It's pretty bad when you only want 4 items on your sandwich when they offer several and it's still wrong. Too bad. Would have liked to make this our new sandwich spot. Why keep getting sandwiches when they aren't right????
I have been in Vegas for 10 years and this is one of the best roast beef sandwich I have tasted.  I will definitely be back . Sorry subway I found my new Sandwich Spot :)Yummy
The best little sandwich shop in town!! Get the Dutch Crunch bread. The hubby and I will be back for sure.

Wonderful spot... Awesome sandwiches decent prices . Second time going and have been very pleased .  Would give it a 5-star but each time something was missing . First no avocado on my carter . Second time asked for bacon on my Bayer necessity but they forgot , however I was not charged for it . Will continue going!  Place has been open for about a month , I can only see it getting better!!
Hole in the wall shop that makes a damn good sandwich. Had the Carter and it was a darn solid meal. My mouth still is watering from the sauce. I'll be back to try em all.

Went here three times in a row! Every sandwich I tried was amazing! I recommend the sweet roll bread for your sandwich, cause it's ADDICTIVE! And so far my all time fav sub from this place is the Carter. But trust me I don't think you can choose a bad sandwich cause everything I tried was really yummy! The owner and staff are super nice a friendly as well. I will be back next time I'm in the area!

Love, Love, Love this place. Rob the manager is a awesome good who treats you like family. There always trying to make you feel good as soon as you walk in. Pretty big menu with alot of flavor and something for everyone. Reasonable prices. I recommend this place to all.

Decided to stop in for lunch after reading all the reviews. I got the Tom Slick(roast beef, cream cheese and bomb sauce) with the Dutch crunch bread and all the veggies, shit was bomb son!! The fresh roast beef paired with the cream cheese was an unreal combination. Super fresh food from the bread to the meats and veggies. Their house made sauces and chocolate chip cookies are bomb. I also got the potato salad. It wasn't very good at all which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. I'll definitely be back to try more.

I'm not a sandwich person usually, but I crave these sandwiches!  The Tom Slick with roast beef, cream cheese and their amazing bomb sauce is amazing!  On top of lots of great ingredients, they use the soft, chewy San Francisco sourdough bread that I can't  seem to find anywhere out of the bay area.  Totally worth a visit!

Life is good...finally found my go to place for a veggie sandwich.  Owner couldn't be any nicer and is serious about pumping out quality food.  Prices are right in line with other sandwich chains, but the selection and taste blows doors on any Subway or Quiznos type of joint...there really is no comparison.  This place has only been open for three weeks and was recommended to me by a lady who works at a boarding kennel down the street...SCORE!

I was pleasantly surprised from this place.  I had a turkey sandwich on the Dutch crunch bread.  The veggies were fresh and tasty, and the sauce on the sandwich  was good too.  Ive never had bread like that before, but I'll definitely be back for it.
Love this spot!!!! They have so many interesting combinations of flavors! I can't wait to try everything on their menu! Definitely a must!

Place was really good. I got the #12 based off the recommendation from the owner. It was pastrami and roast beef i think on the dutch bread. By far the best sandwich i had since moving out here ten years ago.
I'm here right now just here for work wanted a good sandwich and the hotel concierege told me about this place love it! Got the Saucy Chick loved it! Def coming again before I leave :)

Been wanting to stop in for awhile. Glad I had the opportunity today. Sandwich was very tasty...had the Maddy Rose...husband had the Pilgrim. Meat portions were fair, bread was fresh, service was great. I will definitely be back.

Very simple- great sandwiches with great fresh ingredients, five star bread, great unique spreads with lots of personality; all served in a great looking and fun setting. Not to mention spotlessly clean! There is no doubt I will be back!!
The sandwiches are great. Staff works efficiently. The Dutch crunch bread is awesome. Still trying all the sandwiches but all I've tasted have been delicious. I'll make this a regular stop for lunch.

It's a great hole in the wall sub shop. I ordered the Winston Cooper on Dutch Crunch bread. Everything should be served on Dutch Crunch! Ask for a side of the Bomb Sauce and the Psycho Sauce. Great ingredients used in the subs. The staff was friendly and very informative about the product they serve. 5/5 would definitely come back.

I had the pastrami sandwich on the dutch crunch and it was amazingly delicious!!! It's hard to find good quality pastrami that tastes good and isn't fatty and greasy. The owner of the shop was really nice and took his time to talk to us. I will definitely be coming back!

-Overall it was a high quality sandwich that leaves u full and fulfilled. Nice own and staff with fun decor.

I don't come to this side of town often but love stopping by this spot when I do; their sandwiches and customer service are THE BEST! Number 12 and 16 are their specialties..but all are delicious. Don't pass this spot up if you're in the area and feel like having a bomb sandwich with great vibes

Tried this place looking for something new in the area. Glad i did. The dutch crunch makes this sandwich the bomb. Everything was fresh and delicious. Alfalfa sprouts would of made this sandwich to the next level. Keep doing what you guys doing because its on point.....

Ahhhh finally a good sandwich.  I work at a surgery center nearby, and they are always ordering Jimmy Johns or Firehouse subs for us.  And I'm sick of those measly little things.  Finally we found a place with sandwiches for MEN.  Sandwich Spot hits all the right spots -- great bread, thick slabs of meat, melted cheese, pickles and tomatoes, etc.  I don't give away five stars easily, but this place deserves it.
Just had the best pastrami reuben sandwich since I left Detroit 10 years ago. This is a little spot in the strip mall at the N/E corner of Cheyenne and N Tenaya. Reminds me of the delis back East.

We are visiting Las Vegas for spring break. We read the reviews online and decided to give this place a try. We were not disappointed! Took our kids and everyone loved their sandwiches. The Dutch crunch bread rolls, which they said are flown in daily, are yummy! Try the roast beef sandwich #17 or the turkey #18. Beyond really great sandwiches, the employees were friendly and the establishment was clean.

After reading good reviews, decided to check it out.
Excellent sandwiches !!!!
I had the #12 Winston Cooper on Dutch Crunch roll.
Wife had #5 The Spartan on Wheat roll 
Note: The rolls are about 8" sub rolls.
We also opted for everything on the sandwiches and the combo meal which is with unlimited soft drinks and small bag of chips.
Very pleasant people.
WILL DEFINITELY GO BACK AGAIN.. (We already have our next sandwich selections picked out :))
Cool place with friendly staff and unique sandwiches.  I had the pastrami sandwich, and it was great.  Brooke had the Supernova.  It had a little spice which was so nice.  Enjoy.
Had the meatball sub with the bomb sauce and it was amazing! The staff is friendly and the food is delicious!
Asked staff for the most popular sandwich and it was AMAZING! I can't believe I ate the whole thing!

Was in the area and decided to try this place. Had the trifecta (BLT) on sour dough with their special sauce and onions. Nothing outstanding, they did pack on the bacon however. Bacon wasn't too soggy or greasy so that was a plus. For the price I would go down the street to another sandwich shop.
Great food!!!! Amazing bread, dutch crunch was the best!!!!! Definitely going to be a regular here

They have a nice selection and everything tasted fresh.
I tried both the Runnin' Rebel and the Italian Stallion on the Dutch Crunch roll.  Both were good, but missing that hard-to-identify component that turns a good sandwich into something crave-worthy.  
I would consider coming back for a quick bite, but wouldn't necessarily go out of my way for it.

Cute little place and I would like to review the salads my boyfriend and I ordered but unfortunately we haven't received them yet.  The other four people in our party were almost finished and we still had not received our salads.  When I mentioned this to the woman in back of the counter she said " we make them fresh" to her I replied "it's just a salad".
I really wanted to like this place.

The reviews were right on this one, one of the best sandwich in town! I've created my own and tried a few signatures, I loved them all. Dutch crunch bread is a must try and their selection of sauces are great. What makes them stand out even more is the customer service, very friendly and welcoming staff! It's a ways from my house but definitely worth the trip. Also, sign up for the rewards program! They text you special offers like $1 off or free chips etc.

Pretty good sandwiches, lots of meats, good prices. The sandwiches are basic, so nothing fancy. This also makes them a little on the bland side. I would like some herbs in there, some aoili's, more interesting dressings etc.

But, all things being equal, great place!

I have nothing bad to say about this place. Boyfriend recommended it since I was in the mood for a really good sandwich. I'm surprised I had never tried it before since I frequent that shopping center. 

The employees were all very friendly and accommodating and the sandwich I got was BOMB. will definitely be back!
First let me say the sandwiches are amazing! I've only had 2 so far on 2 separate visits.

I love this place! I'm so glad I found it.
Two Words: DUTCH. CRUNCH.

I've eaten there four times so far, and already earned free chips and a drink through their rewards program!

Their "bomb sauce" is great and I add it to every sandwich. It is a little pricey, but if you come during their happy hour, it's a great deal!

The staff has always been friendly and fast.
Best sandwich I have had in Las Vegas. I ordered the #2 Turkey, bacon, avacado on a Danish crunch roll.

If you're looking for an awesome hole-in-the-wall sandwich shop, this is it. First time trying the place out and I will definitely be a frequent customer moving forward. This is probably the best sandwich shop in the area.

The menu has a great variety and the food is really good. I more than likely won't be going back there because one of the guys behind the counter had a pretty long beard and wasn't wearing a hair net over it. So the whole time I'm eating my sandwich I'm thinking if any of his facial hair is on my sandwich. So I won't be going back. Sanitation is very important to me.

4/26/17 I changed my star status for this place because the owner contacted me about my concern and assured my confidence in his effort to make sanitation a priority. I will definitely try this place again!

Easily one of my favorite sandwich places. I get the Spartan on Dutch crunch with everything on it. I love honesty from the employees in restaurants and they never fail to steer me away from something if they know flavors will clash. Decent prices for good food and the staff is always nice. Keep it up guys

A fantastic sandwich; perhaps the only sandwich place i have craved....EVER.  The bread!   The delicious bread!  Vegetarian sandwich is the best - fresh ingredients...and SPROUTS, which you don't find often these days.   Absolutely fantastic!     Why the 4?   The hours.    I live less than a mile from this place and it's a family favorite.    I work near The Strip and often want to pick it up after work for dinner, but they close at 7pm.   Sharp.   I called to place a carryout order (same 3 sandwiches every time and always perfect!)  and told them GPS says I'll arrive at 7.   They informed me that they lock the doors at 7pm signifying that I couldn't place an order.     Bummer.    With all of the high scores they receive, I wish they would consider extending the hours.    Ended up down the street at a competitor, who, incidentally, was busy.

Move over other sandwich places. I have found my favorite "Sandwich Shop"!
First time trying #16 and loves everything about it. Bread if fresh, juicy Turkey, fresh avocado and delicious special sauce with all the extras. Looking forward to my next sandwich very soon!!
Thanks for opening a great business in the neighborhood.

Awesome sandwich shop with awesome service and unique sandwich combos.  I really enjoy the Italian stallion, roger that, and the Tom slick.  Bread is really good but if you don't want a roll they have fresh sliced bread as well.
Finally, a sandwich spot that deserves all the credit for throwing more than one slice of meat on a sandwich (Subway).  #23 is delisioso!

Happen to be on this side of town and was looking for a healthier sandwich place to take my dad to after leaving the hospital.  I found this restaurant on Yelp and we both found something delicious to eat.  Forget Subway and enjoy a handmade, fresh sandwich from The Sandwich Spot.  I had a Vegan (Vegetable) on wheat roll with their roasted pepper hummus.  DELISH!  I wish this place was on my side of town.

Been looking for a new sandwich place.  Found a great one.  Talked with the owner.  He walked me through all the choices.  I chose the All American,  a hot roast beef sandwich with 1000 island dressing? Lettuce, tomatoes,  onion and cheddar cheese. Lots of choices as far as bread and toppings.  I recommend the Dutch crunch roll and all the way with toppings.  Price may seem a bit on the higher side but this place is comparable with Jimmy Johns. Definitely worth it
 I'll be back
Sandwich making is a craft not an art, and the Sandwich Spotters have nearly perfected it. 5 stars.

First time here and will definitely not be the last. I got a "basic turkey sandwich" Turkey, peper jack cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomato, mustard,mayo, onions & peperoncini on sliced toasted sourdough bread! Sooooooo freaking delicious! ! Happy hour is Monday - Friday from 4 to 6 pm. No extra charge for avocado!! Haha.. so splurge! ! Treat ya self!
Great hole in the wall! I ordered the Carter and let me tell you, it's AMAZING! Staff is friendly! Will Def try other sandwiches. If you go make sure you try the Dutch bread,  phenomenal!

My husband and I wanted a delicious sandwich and we found a place we will definitely go back to. 
I ordered The Carter and WOW! From the bread to the sauce it was great. I did not order the mayo, mustard, tomato or onion on mine but the flavors were all there. 
I've tried other local sandwich shops near me and we have not been satisfied until now. 
The employees were kind and provided recommendations my husband and I listened to! 
If you are looking for a local sandwich shop check it out you won't be disappointed!
Best sandwich in my 7 years here in LV!!!!!!  The Carter! Good as they get----w/sourdough that is!!!!
Had the Winston Cooper today, it never had a chance. I'll be back tomorrow and the next day.

Best sandwiches in town, even better than Capriotti's. It's so good you'll crave it in between visits. The Dutch crunch bread is something special, and so is the bomb sauce; both are great with the #4 Maddie Rose. Be prepared to pay a bit over $10, and don't go if you're in a big hurry, it's not Subway.
Some of the best sandwiches I have ever had. Very unique, awesome sauces, just pure deliciousness. I would eat here everyday if I could.
I was pleasantly surprised by this place, fresh sandwiches in a clean environment for low pirces. Yummy food keeps me coming back, but the freshness is the thing I like the most.
Ordered several sandwiches and they were all amazing. Simple menu and great prices. Will Definitely be my go to spot for a sandwich when in town.

My first visit was when I realized this location was trending on yelp awhile back.  I visited on a Saturday afternoon.  I ate a sandwich.  I liked it.  I can't remember what it was.  But...I know I liked it.  And so....my review would wait. That was until...I was tasked with the answering the question, that is..similar to answering the question of one's existence....."Where are we going to eat lunch?"  Remembering how much I liked TSS, I threw it out there.  I was happy it was accepted..now I could write a review.  Upon our visit, the one thing I noticed right off the bat, was the staff was not as helpful as I last remembered on my previous visit. I started to panic, but when I spied the "The Winston Cooper"  I knew everything would be alright.  The Winston Cooper incorporates a delicious combination of hot pastrami, roast beef, and salami.  You get your choice of cheese, i chose American.  I wanted everything on it.  This included Mayo, Mustard, Secret Sauce (Garlic/herbs & Olive Oil), Lettuce, Tomato, Pickles, Onions & Peppers.  I asked for a side of "Bomb Sauce"...this beauty is a fusion of Ranch and Jalape√±o.  I chose the "Dutch Crunch" for bread.  It was a solid roll. This excellent sandwich was paired with some chips and a fountain drink.  If your looking for drink to just go with a sandwich, check in...your gonna get a drink for free (As of October. 2015).  Overall, I found the ingredients to be very fresh.  I look forward to visiting again!!

Yummy yum!!! This place is hella good! The staff are kind and attentive! The sandwhiches are delicious! The pickles are amazing and made in house so you know they are fresh! Plus, theres this blackboard wall near the back where you can grab some chalk and add to the wall with your own art! Totally worth the price!

Great sandwiches and interesting (and yummy!) filling combos. I love the Dutch Crunch roll, but it makes a mess. Sandwiches are ridiculously huge, I'm lucky if I can finish 1/3 of one.

Worst thing about this place is the location, it's hard to spot. (Cheyenne & Tenaya, Target shopping center but other end by Tenaya)

We walked into this eatery at lunchtime. Now I've had a sandwich from here before and it was very good, but I was curious about the atmosphere and service of this establishment. What I noticed right off the bat was the cool lit up sign on the wall as you walk in. Along with a sense of simplicity and cleaniness. While there, the staff and owner were very friendly and helpful concerning questions and suggestions on the menu items we settled on. #1, #2, #12 and #17 all on wheat bread and three of them combos. Which means they come with drinks & chips. These sandwiches are delicious and quite substantial, though you wouldn't think so at first glance. The prices are very reasonable considering that they're gourmet sandwiches. I finally got a chance to eat at "The Sandwich Spot" and it showed to be a worthwhile experience.

Stopped in here for lunch one day and have been back a couple times since. The sandwiches are big and filling. My first visit I had a pastrami sandwich and it was good but there wasn't enough meat so I paid for extra meat the next time and dude hooked it up. You can customize your sandwich to your liking. I have figured out after having a few of the sandwiches here that I like mine with everything but pickles. I like pickles and especially on a pastrami sandwich but here they taste more sweet then dill and it throws the flavor off. They have different breads to choose from and the dude told me that some of the bread is flown in from San Fran and baked right at the shop. I chose the "Dutch Crunch" aka "Tiger Bread" depending on where you are from and it's really good bread. I had the Italian sandwich a couple times now and the sandwich was not consistent between visits. This last time it was doused in oil making it not as enjoyable as previously. The sandwiches have still been way better than average and I like this addition to the area.

Cranberry, cream cheese, bomb sauce, oh my! Crazy-ass sandwiches are here in Vegas from the Bay area: Sandwich Spot is like the Diet-Coke version of the wild combinations at Ike's, but I'll take what I can get here in the desert.

Got the Carter, overflowing with hot turkey, avocado, bacon, cream cheese, and bomb sauce. Plus the usual lettuce-tomato-pickle-mustard-kayo-onion thang.... except someone forgot the bomb sauce!  Also, the cream cheese was applied so sparingly that I couldn't detect it- either it was forgotten too, or the sandwich artists are taking care not to overwhelm the tastebuds of Las Vegas.

Sandwich Spot makes awesome sandwiches as a chain, and I'm understanding of flaws given that they just opened, but I'll be ordering dine-in until my meals start matching my orders. Glad to have you guys in Vegas, please post the menu behind the counter so employees can be sure to get it right.
The sandwiches are to die for.  We ordered The Italian Stallion, The Tom Slick, and The Pastrami Mommy.  Bye bye Subway, hello Sandwich Spot.
The #12 with pshyco sauce is crazy good. But what makes the meal is the Dutch Crunch bread!  That stuff is like crack!  All the other sandwiches are great though.
Best sandwich shop in Vegas. Staff is great, the owner Rob is awesome. First time here and I'm hooked!

The sandwiches are flat out amazing. In all honesty. If I were offered sex or have your sandwiches, I would probably have your sandwiches more often than not. They are that amazing. If you haven't been...then your missing out.

Stopped by here for lunch one day and got the Italian stallion sandwich with everything on it as it comes on sourdough bread. The sourdough was probably not the best choice being a harder bread but it was a delicious sandwich. The menu is small and simple. I Looking forward to stopping by here again the next time I am in the area. I would like to try everything on the menu at least once!

My boyfriend and I tried the sand which spot last night and we were disappointed. I got the Carter and there was way too much cream cheese on it and the turkey was not the best deli meat. My boyfriend got the Winston cooper and wasn't blown away by it, but was decent. Maybe it was a bad day to go but I don't see us returning.

Stopped in for lunch on a Saturday with my brother. The food at this place is great! The bread is fresh and made in house. I got the Dutch Crunch which has a little sweetness and crunchy top. There was a large selection of sandwiches. You can add bomb sauce to them which is a house made sauce with a little spice to it. The staff were friendly. Prices were reasonable. I believe they said that the spot will change names soon and they plan to made a few more types of bread. Definitely worth a visit.

The sandwiches were great. Delivery was ahead of stated time. For the price, $8.00  a sandwich,they should at least give you chips and a pickle. It wasn't an option on the delivery menu. Maybe it's different if you pick it up. Something to think about.

Sandwich Spot, where have you been all my life? And why have you been letting me eat at subway all this time? More times than not, I want a sammie for lunch so I was pretty stoked to find this place. Very clean and friendly staff. Already thinking about going back to try the other options. 

Since my kiddos are sourdough fanatics, I got them the plain turkey & cheese on sourdough. They loved it. And I think that was the softest sourdough I've ever had. Yumm! Just wish they would've mentioned the kid-menu before hand. There's no way my kiddos could've finished that regular sized sandwich. But no biggie, now I know and you do too. :) 

The sandwiches are packed with flavor and fresh ingredients. Try The Carter: hot turkey, avocado, bacon, cream cheese and bomb sauce. So good and big enough to share. So next time you're in the area, bring your sammie-loving buddy and go Dutch...Dutch Crunch that is. ;) See what I did there?

This was my first time here. I was in the area because I have clinicals at mountain view hospital. A nurse suggested that I come here to eat for a good sandwich - not too heavy and not too light. When I first walked in, the decor inside was uber cute! It kind of reminded me of those cute shops in Los Angeles or San Francisco. They had alot of different types of sandwiches. The menu sign was even cute! but difficult to read for my old eyes so I needed to read the menu that was printed out in the front lol I ended up getting the BLT with avocado on it - I forgot what they called it but it was really good. You have the option of adding on meats or veggies and you also get to choose what type of bread you want - toasted or untoasted. I chose toasted wheat slices. My friend got the veggie sandwich with toasted rye bread with some added turkey slices. We both really like our food. Everything is freshly made to order so it took a little longer than subway haha I would definitely come here again!!!!

Can't remember her name BUT her service was phenomenal. We were headed down to the GC and stopping in Vegas for a quick bite. She made great recommendations and we had such a pleasant break in our long trip with exceptional sandwiches. Definitely stopping in next time we're in town!

The carter hot sandwich! Made to perfection. 
Turkey, bacon, avocado, bomb sauce & cream cheese....yes, cream cheese! I was very skeptical about this combination but I gave it a try and I do not regret it at all. I got mine with everything on it so in addition, I had lettuce, tomatoes & banana peppers. Don't hesitate!!

I had a free yelp drink that they had no problem redeeming for me. 

The shop is small, but welcoming. I'll definitely be going again soon.

This is easily one of the top 3 sandwiches I have ever eaten in my life, and I'm not very young anymore. The Carter #16 with the jalapeno ranch bomb sauce was what I experience, pushed over the top by the spectacular dutch crunch bread. If you're in Las Vegas, do yourself a favor and get one of the best sandwiches you ever experience.

I don't normally write reviews but I had to do it for this place. I've lived in Vegas for 8 years now and have been searching for a place to get a sandwich on dutch crunch like I use to get back home in San Francisco. I had no success until today. I use to have family members send over dutch crunch bread when they would come to vegas to visit. That's how much I would fiend for the taste of the delicious crispy flakey rolls. I got the Pastrami Mommy on dutch crunch with no mustard. The sandwich was awsome. The first bite had my head nodding in satisfaction. The bread was soft crispy and flakey. My portion of meat was good and their secret garlic sauce is off the hook. I'll definitely ask for extra secret sauce on my next vist. I was able to talk to the store owner who was really cool. The founder of The Sandwich Spot was co-founder of the San Francisco famous Mr. Pickles. If you know about Mr. Pickles then you know this place is good. He said they get their dutch crunch shipped in from the famous Boudin bakery in San Francisco twice a week. I'll definitely be back again! I encourage everyone to give it a try and support them. Support my dutch crunch addiction!

Winston Cooper who ever he may be deserves a Gold Medal in this winning sandwhich. It is one of their many popular sandwhiches and after today I know why. Get it on their famous dutch crunch bread and you will be blown away at how amazing this sandwhich taste. I can't wait to try other sandwhichs that they have but hands down this place gets the nod! If you are looking for a good sandwhich and not an ordinary one then you will love this place.

I have had my eye on the sandwich spot for awhile now. Finally got to try it out with some coworkers today. I was worried there would be a long wait but the folks behind the counter were not only super friendly they had food to the table in a breeze. The sandwhich was really good. All the veggies tasted fresh and overall the pilgrim was tasty. I like the prices here, very fair. 

I will come again and look forward to trying some more sandwhiches.

Wow! This place will surprise you! Sandwiches are unique and ingredients very high quality - you would think it would be more expensive but it's really an affordable lunch. Locally owned too so we will be back often!

Excellent excellent excellent what a sandwich shop is suppose to be. Sandwiches so big my girlfriend could only finish half of hers. Oh and Macaroni salad is to die for simply amazing. We will back for sure.
One of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time! I got the #6 on Dutch Crunch bread. I love all different types of sauces so this place was perfect for me! I will definitely be coming back!

I absolutely LOVE coming for the sandwiches! the Carter is so great and the bomb sauce is simply the "Bomb". I have to say that the last couple times though when I have come, especially when it's let's just say 6pm, they close at 7, you don't get the friendliness that you look for coming to a great sandwich spot. It's almost awkward. No smile and like it's a burden to make the bread you want! Very disappointing!!! I really hope next time is a more welcoming experience because we love this place! We'll give it another chance. Again.

Only had the carter so far but it was amazing. First class ingrediants, all breads made in house, and a very unique menu combined with top quality service make this place a winner. 
Can't wait to go back and have the meatball. And the Reuben. And maybe the rest!

I've been here twice now. Ordered the Darius vegetarian sandwich with everything except sprouts on dutch crunch bread. It is the best vegetarian sandwich!!!  The Spartan #5 and #1 Italian are also delicious. Will definitely be back!!!

Ah-may-zing ! That is all ! 
 I got the build your own sandwich 
Turkey, Swiss on Dutch crunch with everything ! Killer sandwiches

BEST sandwich shop ever!!!  Wow, what an awesome little gem!  The customer service is amazing, the business is very clean, they are extremely generous with the portions of your sandwich, and it is just an overall friendly environment!  Great for date nights and small family get togethers!!!  They have the most delicious bread... The Dutch Crunch Roll... TRUST me... SOOO good!  My husband got the Maru and he loved it!  I got The Carter and I was blown away!!!  Cream cheese on a sandwich???  Who knew that it would be mouth watering good!!!  HIGHLY recommended!!!  Oh and yes don't forget their gelato!  My husband and I got strawberry and also salted caramel.... YUMMY!!!!!  Enjoy, you won't be disappointed!!!!

I'm shocked, like some other people,  that this place gets such great reviews. When I first walked in,  a friendly guy behind the counter greeted me and put me at ease.  Unfortunately,  he was on his way out for his break.  The other woman behind the counter was grumpy,  lethargic and moving slow. She excused herself to go to the bathroom send when she returned and was serving food she wiped her nose on her arm,  then proceeded to prepare food,  clean never wearing gloves. She looked sick and seeing this made me sick and loose my appetite,  wondering if I'd be sick later.  Sketchy experience,  will not return.

On a yelp recommendation we stopped for a quick bite..... we were NOT disappointed we had a Ruger on the Dutch crunch roll. SUPER FRESH AND TASTY!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND this Sandwich Spot- Mmm  thanks again Yelp

Fantastic sandwiches. I've been here a few times and I always get the same thing: #12 the Winston Cooper on dutch crunch with psycho sauce. I'm really surprised they're not super busy all the time because #12 is the best sandwich I've ever had. Also their cookies are made fresh everyday at 11am and they're really good too. They have a nice relaxing atmosphere, a great spot for lunch or dinner.

Great new shop that has delicious sandwiches, does great catering platters and is an awesome change from the usual sandwich places that cater in the NW area. Always ready on time and staff is the best!!!! 
Highly recommend it  I love the Roger That #2 definitely worth a try
I come here at least once a week. Love the staff. But they're usually out of sprouts! Their Dutch crunch bread makes up for it though :) must try!
Bomb.com! Just go there.. Order anything on the menu and you will not be disappointed. I order "the carter" and the wife ordered "the Swiss miss"... Arguably the best sandwich shop in town!
The Tom Slick on Dutch Crunch is the best sandwich I've ever had!! I highly recommend the Psycho sauce as well! Go there....you won't be disappointed!

Ever stuck in an office for majority of the day? Well, this spot is where my coworkers and I go for lunch just to "getaway."

If you join their texting list, you can get free soda + chips, or XX $ amount off or free something. It's worth it. 

I've never tried their basic sandwiches. LOL. I'm more of the adventurous kind of person. Therefore, I only get their hot sandwiches. I'm a big fan of the Maru, Winston Cooper and All American. Dang, I guess I just love roast beef. They're all roast beef sandwiches. 

It does get super busy around 11 and 12. Everyone's sandwich spot (I'm so punny, haha) for their lunch. If you can finish your sandwich, they're more than happy to wrap it up for you.

5*

I ordered a basic sandwich with Roast Beef, Swiss, lettuce. tomato and pickles on a sourdough bun. It was  good but the sourdough bun was tough and chewy. The owner mentioned that he was having problems with the sourdough and offered to make one with white or wheat  and I declined but I will be back because this does seem like a good place to eat.

I really have to say it's becoming increasingly hard to find a good sandwich shop that makes a good fresh meal, but this place has all the right pieces in place. The bomb sauce is insane, tell them to let you try it and it will change your mind on what sandwich you want just to have it on it. Must try this place.

I heard about this place and had to give it a try for lunch today, I went in and was welcomed by the staff and ordered the "carter" and customized a few things and they were great about letting me customize the sandwich etc.  The food came out quick and was made right the first time.  I chatted up the owner, Rob who was really nice and told me to try another sandwich next time.  I really recommend this place and is much better then port of subs, jimmy johns etc.

The bread selection here is awesome and the freshness of the bread is phenomenal!  My favorite sandwich is the Darius although, I'm not vegetarian. I highly recommend this place over Subway or any other mainstream sandwich place.

This place is awesome!  I happened to stumble upon it and I'm definitely happy that I did.  I was a little lost scanning their menu and was told that he dutch crunch bread made any sandwich great and they were right!  I've been back numerous times and have ordered a different sandwich each time and enjoyed every one of them.  The meat and veggies always are fresh and crisp and I'm happy to have stumbled upon a mom and pop shop place that I can support.
Great Dining Experience! Even better food, stop by and grab a gourmet sandwich. The combinations are endless

Found them on Yelp and they were pretty close to our house . I got myself and my husband the Binions baller which is pretty much a meatball sub and it was very good. Definitely going to come back and try the other sandwiches!

Best sandwich place in Las Vegas! They have delicious Dutch Crunch bread they fly in from San Francisco that really seals the deal. I have been here several times and haven't been able to get away from the Roger That (turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, cheddar, avocado.) my husband had ordered a few different things, and we have never been disappointed. 

The staff is super friendly, it's clean and bright with trendy, fun decor. I gave up gluten for Lent, and broke that today for a sammich on Dutch Crunch. I am risking eternal damnation for this place people!

Having just finished my Italian stallion I did not want to wait to write my review.  This sandwich deserves my full attention.    I ordered an Italian stallion on Dutch crunch bread with everything.   Everything includes their special sauce - garlic and olive oil - and it's delicious.  My fianc√© ordered a Trifecta - BLT add turkey.  Combo'd up for two sandwiches and a tip for around 20 bills.   

The Italian stallion: ham, salami, prosciutto, provolone and Italian dressing on Dutch crunch with everything.  Everything - mayo, mustard, secret sauce, lettuce, tomatoes, onions and peppers.   The sandwich does not disappoint in shape, size, amount of meat or taste.   The bread is AMAZING.  It has a great crunch without being over the top thick.  The meat was delicious and I felt like it was the right amount.   The whole sandwich was just wide enough to make me stretch to take a bite but not wide enough that I couldn't take a bite.  

The Trifecta - triple decker of bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado.   Ordered with a turkey addition and gluten free bread.   My fianc√© said it was by far the best gluten free sandwich ever made and the best part - no up charge for the gluten free bread.  Usually costs two-three bucks more.  Ouch....    The quality of the sandwich was amazing.   I would order and eat it, even with the gluten free bread.  And that says a lot.  

The service:   I had a chance to talk with the owner.   A tremendously nice guy with genuine service in mind.  The staff making the sandwiches were friendly and personable.   I give this place 5 wonderful stars.   I will, absolutely, come back.   Thanks for a great sandwich!
Authentic sandwich experience with a unique niche of soul in all aspects. Hard to try only one. Bread comes from San Francisco and sauces are bosses.

Been here twice and decided to review it after seeing if it was as good the second time.  Delicious.  Both times it has been excellent.  The Dutch crunch bread is tasty,  the size of the sandwiches is good,  and the dressing is also very good.  Overall,  not much to say that hasn't been said.  Super delicious and I'm looking forward to trying a few more.  Had the miss swiss most recently and it was superb.
First time customer and was blown away, not just by the food, but also the customer service, it was an outstanding experience, will most definitely be back to try new sandwiches!
Delicious/fresh/Clean place to eat.  Will definitely be back.  'Roger that' and 'Winston cooper' are what I recommend. Dutch bread....do it

Eh. My sandwich wasn't bad. It was great either. It was a fairly run of the mill sandwich. Maybe  I didn't try the right one. I don't know exactly what I was expecting. Perhaps more flavor? I got the Carter on the Dutch Crunch roll. I will go back and try something else eventually but I'm in no rush.

I'm not usually on this side of town but I have been for about a week for a site visit for work. I came here every day and was never disappointed. The Italian Stallion was excellent, especially with the crunchy bread.
The Winston Cooper with psycho sauce is the jam. Do yourself a favor and plan a visit.

Been wanting to try this place since it opened. First of all, great menu! I went with #16 The Carter on Dutch Crunch bread... So very very yummy!! I'm excited to come back and try another one of their other 24 sandwiches!

Awesome!  That's the only word necessary to describe this sandwich spot.  I had the #19 with turkey, prosciutto, avocado, and Swiss and it was amazing.  The wheat bread is soft and delicious.  The meats were a perfect blend of flavor.  The avocado was fresh.  Definitely coming back to try out more of their menu.

Best sandwich in town! So sad that we found this on a whim because I can't stop thinking about it. Unfortunately live on the other side of town. Only been once but had the trifecta and it was so good. Boyfriend had the Reuben on marble rye and it was equally to die for. Potato salad was good. Love all the options for sandwiches.

We have ordered from the Sandwich spot on numerous occasions and it has always been great. My favorite lunch to order. However this last time we ordered was such a disappointment. It took nearly 2 hours before our order came. I even called the shop directly.. no answer. Had to try to get a hold of them through Yelp to find out what happened. When I finally tried to cancel our order, low and behold, the driver shows up with our sandwiches which were super soggy, thrown together and falling apart. I was so disappointed. I don't want to not like this place anymore, but that really left me upset. Not even an explanation of what happened from the driver either just handed us the bag and left.
The Sandwich spot! New and a welcome to the neighborhood! The fresh smell outside drug us in!
First time in the place,  ordered the Runnin' Rebel.  The bomb sauce was excellent, bread very fresh and delicious. The wife ordered the Roger That and couldn't stop talking about how good it was.

These sandwiches are fuckin deliciiiioooouuuus!!! I normally don't order sandwiches for delivery, but I'm so glad I did this time. Their sauce us delish, and all the ingredients seemed fresh. Yumm, yumm, yumm. And when I saw they were near my Target I was even happier. What a great combo.
Every time I come here the sandwiches are awesome! Fresh and very filling!! Love the Italian stallion. Sign up for text offers... Free chips and drink is very worth it! Hip place to have lunch.
LOVE The Italian Stallion! First timer and I will be back!! Friendly Staff! I recommend giving this place a try it will not disappoint!!!

This has become our go-to at work when we want sandwiches.  Fresh ingredients on good bread... Noone is ever dissatisfied with their order.  They'll turn any sandwich into a salad... They get our orders right. And the food is just plane GOOD.

YYYYYYYYYAAAAAAAAAAAAAASSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!

Put a steak in front of me...and a sandwich...and I will choose the sandwich. In fact, put anything in front of me and 99% of the time, I will choose the sandwich. The exception is my mom's spaghetti, but I digress.

The last time I had a sandwich this good was when I was in SFO and after getting back to Vegas from SFO, I seriously considered how insane I would seem to book a flight over just to get a damn sandwich from this amazing little Italian spot (I'm positive there's a review of it on my page...probably along with a photo, aka food porn).

Anyway, my GF brought me here and I fell in love. I CRAVE these sandwiches. My favorite so far is the Italian Stallion (lol). I have no complaints at all. All the ingredients are always fresh, always freshly baked bread, the staff is very nice, and the restaurant is always clean. I kid you not, my GF and I drove across town last night to get sandwiches...we made it 2 minutes before closing and I swear I didn't even wait for the car to stop moving before I jumped out to make sure they didn't close! I ate half my sandwich, I am small after all. And the other half is sitting here on my desk...waiting to be eaten. And man, I want to eat it but then it'll be gone so I'm just battling myself right now.
Wow wow WOW!! The sandwiches are so good!! We ordered the Pilgrim and it was the best I've ever had. Definitely ordering that again, and the delivery was early which was really nice.

Omg. This place is great! The sandwiches are huge and the bomb sauce is perfect. I got the roger that with bomb sauce on dutch crunch. Freaking awesome! They have dutch crunch bread here! That's a big deal to a girl that lived in the bay area. The service was great too. The sandwiches are a bit pricey but well worth the money! You need to try one of these sandwiches. Check in for a free fountain drink.

Our first time here and we will definitely come back to try other sandwiches on the menu. It's a small sandwich shop but the owner and servers are friendly and helpful. Prices are reasonable for the size of the sandwiches. We got the Italian and grace Lucia both on Dutch Crunch. The ingredients were fresh and scrumptious. Both sandwiches were delicious to bring us back. Definitely the best sandwich shop in Vegas.

Definitely a unique sandwich. The bread isnt like anything I have had at any other sandwich shop. They have a lot of unique flavors and sauces. It was a tough decision but I was very happy with the chicken sandwich I got. The staff was friendly and very informative when I asked a question. Definitely worth trying. My only gripe is the price. It was a great sandwich but for the price and size it was very pricey. The sandwich was about 8-9 inches and it was about 10 bucks. They did have a deal with a drink and chips that bit more reasonable.
Great smelling shop as soon as you walk in very clean and nice, and the food we ordered the #3 and #11, was absolutely delicious! Would definitely recommend and will be returning
So yummy! Was excited to try this place after realizing how close it was and that they'd deliver through Yelp. They did not disappoint. The food was delicious and very flavorful.

Love that their is a authentic sandwich shop and not some short of crazy chain. They have many great signature sandwiches and the Dutch crunch is amazing! They also have a happy hour, which I am super excited for! The prices are good and the service is great. It also had a cool atmosphere.

Looking for a quick lunch we opted for "the Spot".  A new sandwich destination in the Northwest.  After reading several yelpers reviews it seemed worthy of a try.  I am sure glad we did because I think it is a new favorite of the fam's.  

Right away I was impressed with the classic Vegas style sign and industrial style sconces on the wall.  The seating area also had a vintage look with the bright red industrial chairs and wood style tables.  I think they did great on the decor of this place and the extra large chalk board was a cool addition.  The menu board was also done very well in this art decco style design and lettering.  Very unique and nice touch.  Now enough about the ambiance let's get to the food.  

I have never heard of Dutch Crunch before but it looked amazing in others photos so this was a decision I did not have to think about.  The menu had tons of choices of sandwiches with fun and witty names.  We ended up choosing the"Winston" and the Darius". The :Winston" was hot pastrami, roast beef, salami,and I put provolone and all the fixin's.  The "Darius is a veggie sandwich with cucs, lettuce, tom, hummus, and avocado.  Both sandwiches were friggin awesome.  They were very good size portions and for a few $$'s ,more we made it a combo with chips and a drink.  The owner brought us some delicious sauces on the side one was called "bomb sauce" and the other I forget what it was called but was like a Teriyaki/BBQ mix which was also good.  

Overall I think this place is awesome! The location is not to  far down the highway so I will be back again and often.  My plan is to tour the entire menu.  

While there I did notice one guy waiting a really long time for his sandwich.  He seemed pretty upset because he was working at the time and in a slight hurry.  I think they kept making his sandwich incorrectly.  They kept assuming he wanted all the veggies or something and had to remake his sandwich it seemed like 3X.  My suggestion to the business owner is to simply ask each visitor what they would like on the sandwich so they do not have to throw mistakes away.  It will be tough to make money if anything goes in the trash.  

The mistake did not happen to us so I give "The Sandwich Spot" 5 stars. Great job!

11-2016 visit 
Had the Pastrami Mommy sandwich. No kidding this was one of the best pastrami sandwiches I have had.  The meat was sliced correctly which made the meat tender and delicate . Also the pastrami had grateful flavor a perfect balance of salt and pepper.  To make the sandwich even better it was piled high on  Dutch Crunch. One of my favorite sammies from Sandwich Spot.

I recently moved from nor cal and this has always been one of my favorite shops. I was surprised to see one in vegas and the best part it's across the street from work so I go here all the time! Highly recommend you to check out this spot!!!
Good solid sandwich spot, and the prices are reasonable. The best part of course is the Dutch crunch. I wish this place was not so far up north or I'd come more often.

This place is great. Alissa is always friendly. She will make sure my order is right and she can make a mean sandwich! She truly cares about her job and customers. Thank you Alissa for always taking such great care of us!!!

I would say this isn't your typical "sandwich spot". I had visited a California location a few years back on a road trip and really enjoyed it. I was pretty excited when I discovered that we had one in Vegas and it's been on my "must go" list since discovery. My boyfriend and I stopped in for lunch and were not disappointed in the least. I had The Spartan with pepper jack on Dutch Crunch bread while he had The Pastrami Mommy with swiss on wheat. Both were awesome and so fresh! My boyfriend continuously commented on how good the wheat bread was. Noticed the 5-7pm happy hour they have Monday thru Friday when all sandwiches are $6.99. We will definitely be back!

I ordered the Winston Cooper and it was AMAZING. I'm shocked I didn't come here sooner. Less than $11 for a meal is a win in m book. I enjoy this more than subway. The staff is randomly. The d√©cor is beautiful. This is a wonderful little hole in the wall. I will definitely be coming back to try other sandwiches!

I have finally found a place in Vegas that serves unique and delicious sandwiches! 

The shop has a very open and friendly atmosphere.  All of the employees greeted us as we walked in.  They looked us in the eyes and made our order exactly as specified.  

I ordered the KLC's Pastrami Reuben. It was the best Reuben I've had in the longest time.  The pastrami was just right-not too dry like most places.  It had just the right amount of 1000 island,  mustard,  sauerkraut,  pickles,  peppers, and onions.  They even had marble rye! I'm drooling just thinking about it! 

My bestie had the Sinci Sarah.  I heard they named that sandwich after a very famous and fabulous lady in Las Vegas.  Roast beef,  bbq sauce, and Jack cheese. I snuck a bite- Delish.  

The owner let us try some of the unique sauces they use on their sandwiches. The Bomb Sauce was kind of like a spicy mayo.  Pretty tasty.  Their Psycho Sauce was to die for!  It was a combination on a BBQ,  teriyaki, and the Bomb Sauce.  I hope they bottle that stuff up and start selling it in stores.  I saw that they have a sandwich on their menu that uses the Psycho Sauce.  I am definitely going to try that next time.

First time here, establishment is clean and staff is friendly. The menu is basic... Sandwiches. I tried the " Winson Cooper ". ( heated pastrami , Roast Beef , Salami & your choice of cheese). Comes with pickles, lettuce , onions, mustard,mayo , tomato, banana peppers and secret sauce ( has garlic in it). Last step is your choice of bread, I ordered my sandwich on Dutch Crunch ( it's a very crunchy bread). All sandwiches are made to order so it does take a minute but well worth the wait IMO. Would definitely come back to try another sandwich , very tasty. Oh side note they have a happy hour 5pm-7pm weekdays only, sandwiches are $6.99 you save almost 2 dollars :)

It was good. I love love love the dutch crunch bread. Wasnt a fan of the ham on my sandwhich but I got the one with roast beef and turkey so I just took the ham off but overall would come back again. Its hard to stand out with sandwhich but this place does a great job of doing just that

Well let me tell you the smell is devine. The food is fabulous. Service is great a nice change in sandwich Spots (pun intended). Pictures to follow. They are not afraid if mixing different meats in the sandwich

Best sandwiches around! Food and staff are great! We eat there at least once a week. I think I could eat there everyday. I love the Darius on marble rye, best veggie sandwich ever. I like a side of bomb sauce with mine. The Pastrami Mommy is also amazing and the Winston Cooper...aaaand the Grace Lucia. You really can't go wrong eating here. Salads are good sized and tasty too. I can't say enough good things.

Been looking for a sandwich shop and came across The Sandwich Spot on Yelp. After reading the reviews, I had to give it a shot. I'm so glad that I did! 
I had the turkey, avocado, provolone sandwich with the Dutch crunch bread. Loved it! 
I recommend stepping outside of the box and trying this place.
After passing this place by many times, I decided to give it a try today. Got Th Italian stallion sandwich on Dutch crunch bread. Very tasty! I'll be back!

Went here to get sandwiches. Brought the pastrami mama and The Winston cooper.. sandwiches are pretty good but I found a hair on top of my sandwich.... Had them remade it and the girl with the long black hair looked at me and the food like I am bothering her? Seriously that's not acceptable especially when they are the one that messed up

My boyfriend got me something for lunch here because he was near by. I got the spartan hot sandwich with white bread and Swiss cheese. It was surprising really good!!! The sandwich was really juicy and the sauce was bomb! It was a good portion for the price. My boyfriend got a sandwich himself and I wish he would have gotten me the Dutch bread. It had a good crunch to it. I would definitely recommend this place and next time I'm getting that Dutch bread. :)

Are you a fan of delicious?! Then get your ass over here and try the best sandwich in Vegas!!!!!!! I don't say that lightly either as I am a big fan of Caps and Firehouse and this place is by FAR better. 

Unique combinations of meats and veggies with their incredible sauces make this place a MUST STOP if you're a fan of sandwiches. 

I got the Carter and it's more than delicious. The sauce works well with the cream cheese, turkey and avocado.

My wife got the Winston with the psycho sauce and as good as my Carter was the Winston was even better. You have got to come try this place.

After hearing about the Sandwich Spot from a few friends, I decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did. 

The decor is very cool. Industrial and clean. I dig it. When I walked in, one of the employees apologized to me for the mess. She was wiping down tables and I saw no mess at all. But her apologizing and acknowledging it was a great bit of customer service. 

Sandwich Spot has over 20 sandwiches to try on a variety of breads. I had questions about the sauces and Dutch Crunch bread and was immediately offered samples of everything. Sweet! Both the Bomb Sauce and Psycho Sauce were delicious and that Dutch Crunch bread was phenomenal. 

I choose the #21 which was marinated chicken breast, hot sauce, blue cheese dressing and pepper jack cheese. I subbed the Bomb Sauce for the hot sauce, added onions and got it on that awesome Dutch Crunch. My request for pickles on the side was no problem. 

The sandwich itself was outstanding. The chicken was warm, which wasn't specified on the menu but was a great surprise. It made the cheese nice and melty. The crunchy bread was a great contrast to the cheese and chicken. The blue cheese was not too strong adding just the right amount of tangy goodness. 

Overall, this is a great place for a sandwich. I see no reason to go to Subway or Port of Subs when you can hit the Sandwich Spot instead. I can't wait to visit again and try some of the other sandwiches. 

Highly recommended!

Good sandwich joint.  My wife and I got the Winston. Delicious pastrami and the Dutch crunch bread is tasty! I would highly recommend - its my 3rd time here and they didn't disappoint this visit either. I'll be back!

I'll second a few other reviews; this place is far! But it's worth the gas money and if you live on the Eastside, it's good for least one visit. 

The Sandwich Spot is the only place in Vegas serving Dutch Crunch sandwiches, as far as I know and if you haven't experienced the Dutch Crunch you're missing out! This type of bread is flaky and crunchy on top and super soft on the inside. Enough about the bread, let's talk turkey, which was the base of my lunch. I went with "The Carter" which is warmed up Turkey, cream cheese, bacon, avocado, and bomb sauce; "bomb sauce" is garlic herbs and olive oil, FYI. The turkey was real thick sliced turkey and not the compressed stuff, but the cream cheese and bomb sauce together was overpowering, the turkey flavor got lost, even the bacon had trouble breaking through. 

The sandwich was still pretty darn good, and this place is definitely worth another trip. Their Veggie sammie (The Darius) looks amazing. Hey, Sandwich Spot please, add another location in Henderson, the Eastsiders will rejoice!
Theeeees Best turkey Sandwich in Las Vegas!! Caprriottis who???? This place rocks!!! I was in  lunch time heaven!! A must try!!! Drive a long distance if you have to!!

My new favorite sandwich shop! This place is so good! Service is amazing, the young man who greeted us was very friendly and asked if we had ever been there before. He asked what our favorite meats were and recommended sandwiches off of that. They have this cool bread called Dutch Crunch which is amazing and hails from San Francisco! We're told it's the only place in town that serves this amazing bread. I got the Roger That sandwich but I ordered it cold and it was delicious. The restaurant is small but very clean and charming little elements like a neon sign inside, a chalkboard wall you can write on, and cool light fixtures through the hallways to the bathroom. I love that they play 70s rock, the music was perfect and really set the mood. Oh, also happy hour is from 5-7pm Monday through Friday!

Always blown away by what The Sandwich Spot has to offer. The customer service is phenomenal and so is their food. The fresh baked cookies are my favorite! I have had multiple choices from the menu and I am always satisfied! Caesar Chicken Salad is also fantastic! Rob is always ready to recommend something when you're ready to try something new!

Best cold cut sandwich in town! Nothing short of delicious. Great big menu, with, yes, traditional sandwiches. Dutch crunch is the way to go, with everything on it. Just phenomenal. I love it! So happy I found this gem!

Sooooo good. The staff is quiet, the sandwiches are the best I've ever had. This is our new sandwich place, I wish they had spinach but it's still so good. Dutch crunch bread is mouth watering. The meat has some fat in it but not too much. I'm very picky with food. All in all its amazing.

Super fun spot for a Sandwich! I mean I was craving a good just nice sandwich and Boom! This place popped up! 
So, bam service was D'Bomb diggity " oh right" ...
He had my order :: she checked me out and was able to give small conversation!! Love that.. Not just $$ and thank you.. 
It was a good sandwich and I love the decor but the bar is weird ?? Minor minor detail... But would come back for another if I am in the area again!
Real Prociutto in the Italian sub for like 8 bucks.. seriously good stuff. The crackled bread is the move too. Best sandwiches I've had in vegas. I love this place!

I hate giving bad reviews, but this place keeps coming up with great reviews and I've almost come here again because of it!  I was so disappointed in my sandwich, the bread is not good, their idea of an Italian is off,  and the enthusiasm of others about their awesome sandwiches put me over the edge!  Maybe I'm just a fish out of water here in the desert, idk what I expect from a state who doesn't know what Italian salad dressing even is!  I miss my delis :(
Good fresh food, nice people working there, a great little sandwich spot, locally owned, I really can't say enough nice thing about the place.

Hands down the best sandwich I have had for as far back as I can remember.  I placed a pick up order for the Carter hot sandwich, it did not disappoint, exceeded my expectations.  Fast service, owner was very nice.  I will definitely be back!

Oh my gosh I have been looking for the next best sandwich shop and I kid you not this one is at the tippy top. 

We were so happy to finally catch this gem open, every time we tried stopping by it was closed. 

Walking in, right away you notice the giant industrial style wall decor with their name lit up in lights. It was very appealing to the eyes. 

The place had just open so we beat the lines. After reading all the reviews for this place and seeing some of the photos I already knew what I was going to order. 

Both my wife and I got the pastrami mommy with double meat on the Dutch crunch roll. We got it classic pastrami style with just pickles and yellow mustard. 

The wait wasn't long at all and the customer service was great. When we got our food we were surprised by how big the sandwich was.  This is Definitely  a sandwich you can share. 

The Dutch crunch bread was super good it was crunchy on the outer side yet soft at the same time. Tasted very fresh considering it gets delivered from San Francisco. The pastrami is sliced thick which I love cause you get a real good taste. 

Anytime I'm craving pastrami I know exactly where I'm going , just got to remember to come early
This my favorite sandwich spot real talk their ingredients the freshness everything is on point I highly recommend this place to sandwhich lovers!!!!
Seriously one of the best sandwichs ive had in town! The bomb sauce is literally the fuckin bomb. Had #8 highly recommend! !

Preface: I love sandwich shops. And this one is so so good! I had the buffalo chicken sandwich and my sister got the Italian. Both were delicious! The quality was great and there was a good amount of meat and toppings. The decor of this place is really welcoming and unique. They have this great neon sign hanging on the wall and have a decent number of tables. There is a small outdoor eating area as well. 

I love that you can choose the kind of bread you want (sourdough is my fave). The selection of sandwiches is also impressive. Price is very comparable to other sandwich shops ($7-$8). When I went in one time I actually met the owner and he was very pleasant! The workers are all very polite and I haven't experienced any issue with customer service.

Sometimes there's just nothing that can hit the spot quite like a good sandwich can. Aptly named The Sandwich Spot, this new joint which is a transplant from Sacramento, is looking to do just that. Located on the NE corner of Cheyenne & Tenaya inside the Target shopping center, they are bringing something new to an area that's otherwise surrounded by chains for miles. 

Walking in, you're met with some of the simplest, but coolest decor you can find in a sandwich joint. After some friendly welcomes from the staff and owner, it didn't take long before we had some samples in our hand and a bit of history on the place. The owners brother Binnion (yes, with 2 n's), which whom the Binnion's Baller was named after, actually designed and created just about everything in the store. Everything from the metal light up sign right in front, to the canvas photos on the back wall, to the just about perfectly done hand made chalk signs behind the counter. They also picked out some neat tables and chairs to match the theme of the place, and then made a whole wall in the hallway chalkboard style for guests to add their own little touch. With other unique little things like old school light bulbs, this is definitely a cool change of pace for what's become the norm for sandwich restaurants. 

While chowing down on the little sample pieces of bread with their signature sauces, we started to check out their fairly large menu. Adding to 20+ options that originate from the California locations, this spot adds a couple Vegas-only specialities. Most sandwiches are available on Sourdough, Sweet & Wheat or the infamous Dutch Crunch, which I believe is only available at this restaurant in all of Las Vegas. But for those who aren't looking for a classic sub roll, they also have sliced Sourdough, Wheat, Marble Rye and even a Gluten-Free option. There's currently 24 sandwich variations which range from $7.49-$8.49, and also a "Basic" sandwich, that is almost like a build your own, which also comes out to $7.49 if you opt for cheese. 

I ended up going with a #12, The Winston Cooper, and of course had it made on Dutch Crunch. It's topped with heaps of hot pastrami, roast beef and salami. Each meat was tender, flavorful and sliced at a near perfect and consistent thickness for a sandwich. This particular sandwich is also topped with their Psycho Sauce, which is a combination of their Bomb Sauce (spicy jalape√±o ranch based), their Secret Sauce (secret ingredients) and a bit fusion style with teriyaki in there as well. On its own, this sauce is amazing! It's sweet, spicy, tangy and just as suggested by the owner, goes absolutely perfect with a real meaty sandwich like the #12. Aside from that, all sandwiches do come standard with mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomato, pickles, onions and peppers as well. I'm not a huge fan of tomato or mayo on my sandwiches and they happily made it without. If they'd just add cucumbers and sprouts to the topping choices, I'd be in sandwich heaven. 

Now, the Dutch Crunch bread really is something that lived up to the hype for me. I've never had it in all my times to California, but have heard about it plenty of times. When that oven timer goes off for the bread being baked fresh in here everyday, it's a beautiful thing. What comes out looking almost like dried up, crusty old cheese bread is actually a perfect combination of textures. It has just a slight crunchiness on the top layer, but is warm and soft on the inside. I'm not sure I could even bring myself to try another type of bread here. Combined with their house made sauces, it's a killer flavor and texture profile for a sandwich that will be hard to beat for me.

The Sandwich Spot is definitely a welcome addition to the Vegas sandwich market. With quality ingredients and a pretty large sandwich that can be made into a combo with chips and drink for under $10, I have a feeling there will be plenty of people to agree with that. Plus the service is friendly as can be. I know I'll definitely be coming back, and probably sooner then later.

really great service & food! Lisa was super kind and awesome. Got a cookie & Turkey/bacon/avocado sandwich and it was tasty & inexpensive! Everything was fresh. Atmosphere was cute, hole in the wall type place. Definitely would go back!
I cant decide between bomb sauce and psycho sauce now !! they are both sooooo good!! the struggle is real lol

Decent food, albeit portions are rather small for the premium price. 

We had the roast beef with bomb sauce and cream cheese. Good flavor mix but could have been helped along with some crunch...perhaps a pickle. 

Also had the grilled reuben which was much more successful. Nicely grilled rye added the crunch I wanted. 

On the side we tried the fries. Being a sandwich place with such interesting menu items I was expecting something a bit more special, but alas they are simply out of the bag frozen shoestrings. Not bad, but not great. They have a nice dilly ranch that helped these along. 

Overall a decent place to check out, but with the portion to price ration a bit off compared to other shops I'm not running back.

Hubby discovered this place today, and MAN am I glad he did!! We had the Darius and the Fremont each on the Dutch Crunch bread and they were so delicious!! I have a feeling I'm going to have a new go-to sandwich spot for all my cravings now.

I have dropped my rating of the sandwich shop for one main reason. Price.  Before 9$ for a sandwich (8.50 + tax) now 10$ .  The sandwiches are good the people behind the counter are great, friendly and make a good sandwich. But 10$ it's a good sandwich but not a 10$ sandwich.

A huge menu I don't think I'll ever be able to tackle. Most everything here is good, not super convenient from N LV but def worth the trip. I have had a few of them and can't remember which number they are. The bread is very fresh and the service is great.

I'm gonna start by saying, MMMMMMMM delicious!! We got the Roger That sandwich & the Italian Stallion with the homemade potato salad.  On the "Roger That" we got it with the crunch bread and WOW was it amazing. The "Italian Stallion" we got with the sourdough bread, both of these we delicious and defiantly worth the drive. All the sandwiches are made fresh after ordering. We will be back VERY soon to try some of the other sandwiches they have.

The food here was amazing. The staff were very knowledgeable about all of thier products. They even gave me samples of some so I knew what I liked. This is one of the best sandwich shops in Vegas. The quality and freshness of the meats/breads were awesome (best sourdough outside of SF). I had a pastrami and my wife had the meatball sub. I can't wait to go back and explore the rest of the menu. I was excited the owner said he was going to put tri tip on the menu (can't wait Nor Cal Staple).

Great Restaurant with amazing food .
They offer delivery with EAT24 and GrubHub ...
The food was delivered extremely fast on 14 miles from the restaurant !
Definitely will   Order again !!
Thanks Sandwich Spot
This is a super yummy Sandwich Spot they have some great signature sandwiches and their Dutch crunch bread is amazing make sure you sign up for the rewards card they send you special deals
This place is great...so many options! From vegetarian to meat lovers you'll always find something you like. Staff is friendly and fast, great for lunch or anytime!

One of my favorite sandwich places, offers military discount. The sandwich I chose was the #16. The carter. Hot turkey, avocado, bacon, bomb sauce, & cream cheese. The picture to follow is on Dutch crunch bread, not too crunchy but offers a good bite!
Very bland sandwich but the worst part was the attitude I received from the staff. They would answer my questions as if I was a burden to them. Very annoying. Will not return.

Delicious. Why does this place have to be so far from me?! I ordered the Roger That on sourdough. It was everything I want in a sandwich. Turkey tasted fresh, the sourdough bread was perfect. I highly recommend checking this place out. I ordered extra bomb sauce on the side but the sandwich was so delicious I didn't even use it. I don't know how often I'll get to eat here because it's so far from me... But a definite treat when I'm on that side of town. Seriously so good!

I wanted so strongly to write a 5-star review on this restaurant.  Sadly, I cannot. First, let me state they were very friendly.  Okay...  I ordered a BLT and a Reuben to go to enjoy lunch with my wife. I figure a sandwich shop SHOULD know what a BLT and Reuben are. Well, what I received was the thinnest bacon sandwich  (no lettuce no tomato) ...and a Reuben with corned beef (yes), sauerkraut (yes), thousand island (yes), lettuce (uh no), tomatoes  (uh no), pickles (maybe) and banana peppers (wtf).... I regret tipping and had to reconstruct both sandwiches to achieve any satisfaction.

Simple is always the best! I ordered #19 The Miss Swiss. Hot turkey, prosciutto, avocado & Swiss cheese with the Dutch crunch roll. What a great choice!! I am So coming back for a good hearty sandwich!

The Sandwich Shop is one of the best ! I lived right next to it, and I couldn't help but go once a week before work! The The SinCi Sarah Hot Sandwich is the best off their menu. I strong recommend them!
This was probably the best sandwich I've ever had. Seriously! The 16. "Carter" it was so amazing! Great great service! Everyone needs to go eat here!

The Sandwich Spot is a hidden gem on the Northwest side of Vegas with a great atmosphere and local feel. The customer service mentality is evident when interacting with all members of the staff. The food is excellent quality and absolutely affordable. Bomb sauce recommended. I will be back.
Best place ever, Love it here! The staff really cares and it shows!

Place is a little small and gets busy during lunch time. No biggie though; we ordered 3 sandwiches, all delicious, made to order and great customer service. Can't get better than that.  Can't wait to go back to try something new

Awesome sandwiches! Fresh ingredients. As per yelpers, I ordered exactly what the yelpers screamed for, the Winston Cooper on the Dutch crunch bread. The sandwhich was delicious! My boyfriend ordered the meatball sandwhich, which was honestly nothing special. I feel like this anywhere I go, that meatball sandwiches are just plain Jane. I feel like I can make them at home. I always go for the specialty sandwiches. Anyways, that being said, I asked for the famous psycho sauce and bomb sauce on the side. The psycho sauce is like BBQ sauce. I honestly wasn't too fond of it, like many yelpers were. However, the bomb sauce was just that, bomb!! The garlic taste was so good, that I dipped my sandwhich in that sauce everytime I  took a bite of my sandwhich. The staff was really nice and with a yelp checkin, you get a free fountain soda! Yay!! I will probably go back for the pastrami or rueben next time!

I've eaten here three times so far and all of the sandwiches are 5 star worthy.
