I've tried the KLC, the Carter, and I created my own. The meat is all carving board style which is awesome, veggies are fresh, bread is perfect (and baked there!), and the staff is fantastic. They will accommodate you in almost anyway. Another plus, my two year old loves his kid sandwiches!

Definitely recommend this place. It's also five minutes from where I live.

Macaroni salad taste funny. It was hard and chewy. 
Pickles on my sandwich also had a funny taste.. I can't even describe. Maybe this place is going down, because this has never happen before :(

The Sandwich Spot is a chain that originated in Sacramento, CA. The sandwiches at each location are pretty much the same, but depending on what location you are at the sandwich might have a different name than you are used to. The decor is themed for the different locations also. When I first walked in there was a guy that greeted us and told us a little about the menu and the types of bread they offer. They had 24 sandwiches to choose from and several sounded so good. 

Priced at $7.99 I decided to try the "Trifecta" on sourdough. This sandwich had 3 slices of toasted sourdough with bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado. I enjoyed the sandwich. The bacon wasn't fatty and had good flavor and the avocado was fresh. One thing that really stood out was the tomatoes. I don't know where they get them, but the tomatoes tasted like they were just picked from the garden. One disappointment was the sourdough bread not being fully toasted. The bread was only slightly toasted and because of that there wasn't the crunch I look for when biting into a BLT and instead it was mostly soft. Hubby had a sandwich on their "Dutch Crunch" bread and I really liked that, so I will get that bread the next time. 

They take phone orders and offer delivery (menu says 5 sandwich minimum for delivery) and also do catering.
The reviews on this place are no lie. This sandwich is the business. About $9 for a sandwich. Fresh baked bread and cookies? Yes please! Great food, nice people, do yourself a favor and eat here now.

Definitely one of those hidden gems you'll rarely find around the valley. The sandwiches are amazing, tried the Winston with bomb sauce and I'd HIGHLY recommend it to anyone. The owner clearly cares about his shop and customers as we were welcomed warmly and even given some extra sample sauces that he recommended. If you're a sandwich snob, this is definitely your place! Prices are great, cozy environment, and happy workers make for happy foodies like me!

I found this place through Yelp because I was looking for a sandwich place near home. I wanted to give it a try for I saw their good ratings. 

They had about 24 sandwiches to choose from.  The second time I had sandwiches there was last Tuesday, my favorite is the The Trifecta consists of Bacon, Lettuce, Tomato & Avocado with your choice of bread, I got the Dutch crunch bread which is my fave because it is toasty. I didn't care for their sourdough bread which was not fully toasted. 

I also tried the The Miss Swiss that consists of Hot Turkey, Prosciutto, Avocado & Swiss Cheese, it was tasteful. The The Carter filled with Hot Turkey, Avocado, Bacon, Bomb Sauce & Cream Cheese is my second favorite although I have not tried all of them LOL.

Try to call ahead and make it a meal with chips & a drink for only a dollar more.
They also take phone orders and offer delivery. 

The service is great. The sandwich does take time to make so be patient! We will keep coming back.

"Solid Sammies From Sacramento!"

ATMOSPHERE:

Tucked away in a strip mall on N Tenaya and Cheyenne, The Sandwich Spot is a great local contender with all of the sandwich chains around town. Well lit and inviting, the inside looks like it has the bones of a former Capriotti's  with a nice splash of color, sweet HAND WRITTEN menus and cool decor by the owners brother, two and four tops, high tables, a little counter dining area, and a cool chalk wall in the hallway that anyone can doodle on while your order is being made.


BITES/BEVERAGES:

Dutch Crunch...that's what brought us here. If you've had a good Dutch Crunch Roll before(it's a Cali thing) you know that its a great bread option when constructing a sandwich. They have tons of options to make your own custom sandwich, or you may choose one of their tasty signature sandwiches. I went with the Winston Cooper which was packed with roast beef,  pastrami, lettuce,  tomatoes,onions, peppers, choice of cheese (went with provolone), choice of roll/bread (Dutch Crunch of course!) topped with their psycho sauce. This is one of the best meals under $10 you can get with chips, a drink, and one of their signature sandwiches. Delicious!

CLOSING STATEMENTS:

Great customer service, tasty sandwiches and great price point (Oh, and DUTCH CRUNCH ROLLS!) definitely deserves a return visit...ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  4

Return Factor?  99.9%
This place is so yummy. When we r on this side of town it's a must have. The bread and the ingredients are so fresh and the Dutch crunch rolls remind me of my childhood.

The Pilgrim was absolutely delicious! Wouldn't change a thing about it. My friend asked for light mayo and she still had to scrape the mayo off, but other than that it was good, as well. Hope they open one on the east side of town as this is far from me, but next time I'm in the neighborhood, will definitely go back!

Had lunch here, sandwiches were awesome.  I will definitely be back.  Lots of different options to choose from and the staff is definitely friendly and helpful.   Ask for suggestions if you're unsure of what to get and they will not steer you wrong.   Some combinations might sound odd at first but keep an open mind and try it.

Man my sandwich is delicious. I got the #1 and I want more! 
I live on the opposite side of vegas and If I come anywhere near hear in going back!

This wins the "best sandwich in Vegas" award for me. I get the Carter. The wife got the Italian Stallion. Both super good. Take my advice and get the Dutch Crunch bread. You won't regret it. I've turned on several of my friends to this place and they agree. Good stuff!!
Really great sandwich spot, especially when your burned out on the same old places! Very friendly and fast service! Will definitely be back to keep trying new stuff on the menu.

Lady at the register: What kind of bread?

Me: Do...do you have...uhhh...Dutch Crunch?

Lady: Yeah...

And thus my search has ended. Dutch Crunch in Las Vegas! If you don't know what Dutch Crunch is...well, it's the greatest bread ever. It's a staple in the Bay Area and no sandwhich back home is truly complete without it. 

Yeah, we tend to like it better than even sour dough. 

So when my friend told me that this place had Dutch Crunch. I had to try it. 

I had the number 2. The bread is good and that alone secured their 4 star rating. But I do wish the size of the sandwhich was bigger. Maybe they can offer a large size? 

Overall though, it's a great deal. I got a combo [included fountain drink and chips] for around 12 bucks. 

Will definitely be back.

Came in after seeing all the reviews for this spot and it was definitely worth it! I had the carter since I saw most yelpers were raving about it. They are not greedy with their turkey or any of the add ons in the sand which. I was full with half the sand which but it was too good not to finish! A meal is about $10 with chips and a drink. I did see that they had potato salad but I had already paid. Definitely recommend this place. They do have several choices for sandwiches so it's not limited to just a few.

Fresh bread, the sourdough is so yummy! Everything is fresh.   Makes me happy because I can't eat gluten typically but I can handle sourdough bread. They usually don't have that option at sub shops.   My husband had the pastrami last time we came ( we live in LA, and this place made such an impression on us we had to come back) and said it was really good. I had turkey,  very flavorful. The staff are super nice.  Way better than big subway chains.  Fun atmosphere,  everything is clean.  Definitely a must go when we are in town.

YUUMMY! Super high quality everything, always friendly service. You really can't go wrong here. The only con is that the wait time can get pretty long... if you're in a hurry or only have a 30min lunch break, call in or place your order online. I've ordered in store and online easily... even if you have kids and end up having to wait, there's a giant chalkboard down the length of the hallway for them (and for you!) to draw on. Win win. Worth it.

The gluten free bread was yummy. It was a little wet for take out or less than immediate consumption. I had #5 and the husband had #12. Delicious sandwich. Something those of us who are gluten free don't say very often. I will be back.

Heard about this place through a friend who said it was amazing. Finally tried it out and amazing is a understatement. I could eat the food all day. they have so many options, I had the #6 which was full of so much flavor it was overwhelming. Definitely coming back here

Needed to find a quick lunch on the way back to The Strip from Aliante and simply chose the Chyenne exit randomly.

Finding this place was just what I needed after a long, hot early part of the day on the golf course.

Both employees behind the counter were attentive, friendly and helpful.

The menu has a wide selection of specialty sandwiches or you can simply build your own very easily with most of your ideal deli ingredients.

My specialty sandwich was delicious and customized to my liking with no mistakes at all. (Since it had BBQ sauce, I don't know what they would offer mayo on it as well. Honestly, that mixture sounds terrible.)

Unfortunately, I had no idea what Dutch Crunch was until reading Nate M's review as I wrote mine, so I think I had marble rye toasted instead.

The roast beef on my specialty sandwich was particularly good and they were happy to tell me and show me in advance of ordering that it was not very rare, which is often the case at delis like this and not of interest to me. Other basic toppings tasted fresh and there was plenty of them on there.
Just ok. Don't know what all the fuss is about. Definitely had better, but not terrible.

I was pleasantly surprised. I got the Italian and asked if they could heat it up, they were very accommodating to making the sandwich to my taste. They put a lot of meat in the sandwich and they were very polite and respectful. I must say I enjoyed it.

I went here for lunch today with a friend. We both ordered our food to go. Despite being told there were separate checks, the person chose to put both of our orders on a single ticket. This led to my sandwich being made incorrectly. Instead of the toasted wheat bread I requested, my sandwich was made with the roll she had asked for. I was very disappointed to find the error when I got home, especially after such a long wait. I don't mind waiting if I get what I ordered and paid for. That being said the sandwich was tasty. The bomb sauce was delicious. I also ordered the potato salad. The potatoes were under cooked, quite crunchy, with way too much "goo." It also had a sweet taste which I didn't like. I would never order it again. I'll probably give the place another chance, but I would definitely check my sandwich before leaving and only order chips if I want a side.

#12 Winston Cooper on Dutch Crunch with Psyco Sauce.

Please ike my review after this sandwich changes your life.

Unbelievably impressed by this sandwich spot! Not only are the creative sandwiches the bomb dot com, the upbeat attitude of all the team here is admirable. The energy in this little hole in the wall takes you to another place. Good music, check. Clean and contemporary environment, check. Amazing sandwiches that make you have an outer body experience, check! 

The choice selection is 1 of the best I've seen in a long while, what with their creative and pop cultural naming, it just makes eating a sandwich named "The Roger That" so much more fun! They have over 20 choices of crafted sandwiches as well as a create your own sandwich for the less adventurous and more basic which. The topping, cheese, meats, an condiment lists are endless! They even offer salads for all you New Year Resolutioners. 

What has really blown me away about this great place is the passion and effort everyone here put into making not just a sandwich but a masterpiece your stomach will thank you for and your mouth will be craving for days to come. 

In conclusion though I'd encourage everyone in Vegas give this place a chance, they definitely deserve it! I'll be stopping in regularly.

This is a very nice sandwich shop.  It has really good bread (I had Dutch crunch and lots more that I want to try) and well built sandwiches with creative pairings of meats, cheeses and sauces (bomb sauce was awesome, like a spicy-ranch and not too spicy and the right light consistency).  I can really tell that they use quality ingredients.

The service was really great and I hope they continue with the friendly greetings and check ins.

I will be back to try more sandwiches.
Best sandwiches in Vegas. A bit disappointed they don't have more locations. They need one in Summerlin. Reminds me of Ike's in California with the Dutch Crunch bread... Great great sandwiches.

- The Skinny:

Food Quality: 5 Stars
-  Get the  #12 - Winston Cooper (Roast Beef and Pastrami) on a Dutch Crunch roll with ALL the sauces (Psycho Sauce, Bomb Sauce, etc.) Amazing Sandwich!  This place puts Subway, Jersey Mikes, Jimmy Johns all of them to SHAME!! 5 stars all the way!

Wife had the #10 - the Darius (all veggies) with added red pepper hummus. I'm not one for all veggie anything but it was crisp, fresh, and good. 

They also have great chip selection, Miss Vickies chips!!! 

Pricing: 5 Stars
- Great prices for the size of the portions and the quality ingredients and overall flavor. The bread is thick and soft. #12 goes for $7.50, add a $1.50 I believe for chips and a soda. 

Service: 5 Stars
- The owner and his staff are friendly and really enjoy what they do. They are humble and are very appreciative of rave reviews they are receiving. It is a quality hand crafted sandwich they are making, so there a longer wait then most sandwich spots. Be patient, its worth it!

Atmosphere: 5 Stars
- It looks like nothing much from the outside and its in a older shopping center (left of Target) but inside it has character, even a chalkboard wall to express yourself. Place was designed by the owners friend or brother in law I recall? 

Comfort: 4 Stars
- Plenty of seating, nice tables, place is clean, not cookie cutter at all in there. 

Location: 5 Stars
- Right off the fwy (Cheyenne Exit)

- The Fat: 

We came out of Target and wanted something fast to eat. I noticed "The Sandwich spot and looked them up on Yelp. With high ratings, I wanted to try them. My wife was hesitant because she thinks sandwiches are too simple and not really a meal. 

We were wowed...  this place could just sell the #12 Winston Cooper (Roast Beef and Pastrami) and be in business. Get yours on a Dutch Crunch roll with ALL the sauces (Psycho Sauce, Bomb Sauce, etc.) just like everyone else. GET IT THE WAY THE OWNER SUGGESTS! Psycho sauce, Bomb sauce, anything else he suggests, he knows what he is doing!  You will forget you are even eating a sandwich, its damn good and the best sandwich my wife and I have ever eaten. 

Wife had the #10 - the Darius (all veggies) with added red pepper hummus. I'm not one for all veggie anything but it was crisp, fresh, and good. My wife was super jealous of my sandwich though ;) She loved the #12 so much that she is going to open a Yelp account just to give them a 5 star review. She even told me to go back inside to thank the owner for creating such a great sandwich. Keep in mind, my wife never has liked any sandwiches, she also dislikes roast beef AND pastrami but she LOVED this sandwich! She was geeking out for about 20 minutes over it, lol. 

If you want a sandwich that is truly not fair to the competition, you must try this place. It's going to be one of our regular places.

Awesome sandwiches...

Located along Tenaya and Cheyenne, The Sandwich Spot is a couple doors down from Wine Five Cafe and the old gaming store.

I like this place! The decor has that retro vibe with great staff and really nice owners. The sandwiches are freshly made with bread that comes in from San Fransisco.

Recommendations: Ruben Sandwich and Number 16. I can't remember the name but it's really really good. Put it simply Sandwich Spot blows away all the regular sandwich places -subway, port of subs etc. 

Delivery is offered with a 5 sandwich minimum.
Worth it!!

Overall:
Food: 4-5
Beverage: 3-5 - sodas etc
Service: 4-5
Coming Back: 4-5

I ordered "The Tom Slick", it was ONE OF THE BEST SANDWICHES I HAVE EVER HAD. At first I was skeptical about having cream cheese on hot roast beef but the flavors blended amazingly(get the crunch bread). I also got a side of the macaroni salad, I'm not sure what sauce they add but it's really tasty. I will definitely be trying the whole menu, I suggest you do the same.
Carter with crunch bread bomb.com fav new sammich spot and with club baseball at doc I'll be here for dinner on Tues !!!!
This place was BOMB.COM! I got the carter sandwich, would recommend the carter sandwich with the BOMB sauce :)  Go there...that is all!!

Me and a buddy of mine were cruising around this side of town when I mentioned that a new sandwich joint opened up down the street. I've been curious about this place for a few weeks now so I thought today would be the perfect time. 

The place is nice and clean. The menu had a bunch of sandwich options. We asked the owner what his recommendations were and he was very helpful. The staff were pretty chill and very nice. I had the #20 The Maru and my buddy had the #12 the Winston Cooper. Our sandwiches came out and they both looked amazing. By the looks of it, of course he was enjoying his. My sandwich by the way was fantastic. The bread was also very tasty. We both opted for the dutch crunch rolls. Yum. We were told to have the Psycho sauce(not sure if that's how you spell it) on the side for dipping and wow what an excellent recommendation by the staff. They even let us sample each of their sauces before we ordered. Super cool of you guys.

I went in thinking this would be another trendy hipster spot that would be whatevs but it turned out to be an amazing place that I plan to come back to at least a couple of times a month. I ended up bringing my wife home a #2 the Roger That so I wouldn't have to hear her yapping about why I didn't bring her a sandwich but in all honesty, I got it as excuse to taste it later. Way to go Sandwich Spot. I'm counting the days til my next visit...

A brand new business and I have been here two time already in just a four day span.  Must be good, right?  Right.

The Sandwich Spot is so close to home for me and yet I never knew it was opening up.  I don't go by the shopping center it is in all too often.  It was a co-worker who told me about it.  I am glad he did.

For $9.49 you can get any of their 24 (?) sandwiches, a drink, and a bag of chips.  Not bad.  Perhaps the price is more than that of a place that offers $5 12 inch sandwiches but there really is no comparison.  The breads here are more artisan and the toppings are fresh.  They also have some good sauce selections to choose from.  More on that below.

The first time I tried the Sandwich Spot I ordered a classic Reuben sandwich.  Pastrami, sauer kraut, cheese and Thousand Island dressing on toasted marble rye bread.  Was it the biggest, baddest, thickest stacked Reuben around?  No.  But I can't remember the last time I had a Reuben so good.  The meat was sliced thick enough to not taste like cheap lunch meat but not so thick as to not be sandwich friendly.  It was tender and flavorful.  The sauer kraut was good and crisp with a bit more sour than most krauts I've tried elsewhere.  The bread was the most impressive part of this sandwich when compared to others.  I love a good Reuben on marble rye but oh so often the bread is toasted too much and tears up my mouth.  This was just right a toasty crunch yet still soft enough to not kill me.  That is a hard balance to acheive.

On my second visit I ordered a Winston Cooper on Dutch Crucnh bread.  I highly recommend the bread for any sandwich.  Soft on the inside and crunchy on the out.  Awesome.  As for the heart and soul of the sandwich itself, roast beef, pastrami, salami, lettuce, tomato, onion, pepperoncinis, choice of cheese and choice of sauce.  For my choices I went with Swiss and Bomb Sauce.  The whole package was nothing short of amazing.  Everything on its own was good but the synergy obtained by the combination is just hard to beat.

The Bomb Sauce I had on my Winston Cooper was good but the Psycho Sauce is truely where its at.  I was brought a small piece of bread with the Psycho Sauce drizzled on as a sample.  It is a mix of the Bomb Sauce and the Garlic Sauce they offer.  The two together form a sort of tangy and spicy sauce almost like a creamy Italian dressing.  The next time I am back I am going to get the Psycho Sauce on my sandwich.  It was just too good.  Hell, I would order a side of it to dip my chips in.  Yes, it is that good.

I can see this place doing really well.  It has some awesome food to offer and the staff is great.  They are friendly and fast.  They talk to their customers.  They get their opinions.  The joke around.  They play a good loud mix of music from hip hop to rock.  This is a cool little shop and a true asset to the neighborhood.
So delicious! The sandwich I ate was the Roger That and the description of every other sandwich makes me want to return again and again to try them all. I wish it was closer to my house. Yum!!!
Such a good small spot hidden in the target shopping center. Love the variety, super fresh and unique. The decor is fun. Can't wait to go back and bring the kids to draw on the chalkboard.

First time trying this place and it might just be the best sandwich spot in town. The number 4 rivals Capriottis Bobbie, if not better. I tried mine on Dutch crunch bread without cream cheese and with their bomb sauce to add some spice. It's amazing! Everyone is super friendly. I'll definitely be back.

I really like this spot.  The owners are very nice and they make good sandwiches.  I much rather go here than Starbucks anyway. 

I like the Spartan sandwich.  It's pretty much a bacon, lettuce avocado sandwich.   Their cookies are surprisingly good as well.  

A great lunch spot.  Highly recommended.
Roast beef on Dutch Crunch! Sandwiches were really good and service was great! Lived on this side of town for years and I've slept on this place!

First timer at The Sandwich Spot.  I really wanted a good sandwich today for National Sandwich Day, instead I got a great one. The ingredients were fresh with each distinct addition holding its own. The #7 and #22 was my order and both were delicious. Friendly staff and great sandwiches!!!
FINALLY a sandwich spot that has REAL BREAD! lol The Carter on Dutch Crunch is my favorite! that sauce is !

First time customer and have heard lots of good things especially the Dutch bread. Ordered the Italian Stallion and was asked if I wanted everything on it . Assuming it was what was on the menu listing .I said yes so I got my Italian Stallion with mayo.Which does not go on an Italian sandwich with Italian dressing. I told the woman at register and her reply was I shouldn't have ordered it with everything. I did not see the list of everything on menu til afterwards. So if I ordered a meatball parm I would get mayo too? Or how about telling me what Everything implies .Needles to say my sandwich sucked
Really great sandwiches. For all my SF Bay Area friends they have Dutch Crunch Bread. I have not had this since I left the Bay Area 15 years ago. Delicious!!
Literally the best sandwiches I've ever had my entire life here. Every single time the sandwiches are better than the last and the crunch Dutch role is amazing. Five stars for sure

I love me a sandwich at the sandwich spot. F ya! Vegas has got a sandwich spot, makes my tummy happy. Go here - try the number 2 if you're indecisive. Extra lettuce.

Boom

We were looking for a good sandwich place when we moved to Las Vegas, and we found it!!! Great variety, delicious bread (Dutch Crunch is my fav ever), and friendly staff. Relaxed atmosphere, good music. So happy.
Great sandwich shop, small shop but great sandwich. I had the chicken avocado, great tasting combination. My wife had the turkey sandwich and she loved it. We will definitely return.

I cant find nothing wrong with this place, i love it!!!!!! 
Sandwiches are awwsone and the sause are amazing

5 stars is not enough for my experience today

I has the #12 on a Dutch crunch roll w/bomb sauce

Excellent!! 

I would be super detailed like most everyone else, but the reviews don't lie about this place. Treat yourself you wont be disappointed

Im from California and lived here for about 5 years and couldnt find a legit sandwich spot I enjoyed.  I found the sandwich spot by mistake and dont regret it at all!  Their sandwiches and so full and yummy and unique as they are!  They take your order and make it there and youre in and out less than 10 minutes!  Each time Ive come in Im greeted with happiness and thats hard to come by in Vegas.  If i could give more stars I would!  Love this place!!!
Wasn't busy when I went in and the employees were really nice. It has a nice atmosphere with all the lights and art. The sandwhiches are really delicious!!! Great music selection too

A sammich is only as good as the ingredients its comprised of. Seems the sandwich spot has put effort into each one of them. I had the Italian on the dutch crunch roll. It should've been served wearing a track suit and a gold chain because it was so fat and in your face. Piled high with meat and all the fixings providing a good snap of veggies and the salty chewy of meats. The bread was great. Crunchy with a good hollowness and held together from start to finish. My wife had some turkey and roast beef something or other I don't really know because I had a big old Italian in my face sayin "Fa-gid-a bout-it." kinda sucks they close so early but for about $9 for a sammich, drink and chips I left there feeling so full my inner fat kid was ashamed.

This is hands down the greatest sandwich in Las Vegas mostly for the bread. I got a turkey avocado cold and it was delicious. Even when there was a problem they simply fixed it on my next visit. Can't go wrong with the $8 price definitely worth it

Great sandwiches and extremely friendly staff! The owner is always there, he's so nice and so is his staff. We ordered #2 sandwiches, called 'Roger That' (Turkey, bacon & avacado ) on dutch crunch bread. The bread is out of this world..soft on the inside and crunchy outside. I've also order a sandwich platter from here for a work potluck and they were a huge hit! We'll definitely go back!

I've eaten here three times. It's in the neighborhood and the food is very good. No skimping, quality products, great selection of breads and very friendly service. Go there, get food. You won't be disappointed. Friendly, chill atmosphere. It's a keeper!

I waited to write my review because I wanted to see if these guys could consistently wow me 3 times in a row. Well, they have! Fresh, awesome sandwiches!!  Binnions baller, the runnin rebel, and pastrami mommy are the ones I've had. Amazing food!! Love these guys!!
Bomb.com best sandwiches in town by far! With great friendly people running! You must try the secrete sauce! It's really good stuff

Man, I wish this place was closer to us! Always up for trying new sandwich places and this one was fantastic! Upon reading the reviews, I chose The Winston Cooper which had: pastrami, roast beef, lettuce, tomato onions, & peppers. I got mine with the Dutch Crunch Roll which is amazing! Where has this bread been my whole life?! I also got a side of Psycho sauce which has a gingery spice to it. So yummy! I will definitely be coming back to try the others! If you're looking for a new sandwich spot this place is a must! Great job guys!

DON'T miss this place. Sandwiches made to order. Great for lunch or dinner... I've heard great things about the sauce but I order mine sauce free, because I am a sandwich / burger purist.  If you are in the mood for a good sub thats not chain then come support small business and show theses folks some love.

Fantastic sandwiches. Superb service. Try the Sweet Science sandwich (teriyaki chicken, pineapple, jack cheese) and the Maddy Rose (turkey, ham, roast beef, cheese (and I added some mayo and mustard) delicious! Will be back!
Good food great bread I like the meatball sandwich will be back to try different ones clean and friendly

I was at Target, Cheyenne and Tenaya, and happened to see a sign for a new sandwich spot..... THE SANDWHICH SPOT...lol....
I am sooooooo glad I decided to stop in.....

The atmosphere is amazing... they make you feel so welcome. Staff is proactive in every step of the ordering process... 
It takes a minute to read the menu and the different  names of the sandwiches.

I finally decide on the "Bayer Necessity"....Marinated Chicken, hot sauce, blue cheese dressing & pepper jack cheese.

The buzzer went off on the bread oven and they informed me that the "Dutch Crunch".... was hot and ready.. OOOOOHHH YEAH, SOUNDS GREAT!!!

No regrets!!!!! The most amazing bread!!!!

I guess the dough is flown in from San Fransisco????? I don't know for sure about that, but I know it was some of the best  bread I have had in a while.... For me.... why else are you eating a sandwich..... good bread!! 

My husband had the "Binnion's Baller" house style..... which is the meatball sandwich to the umpth degree.... He said it was the best meatball sandwich he has ever had.
They brought us a sample of the "bomb sauce".... I will definitely order this on my next sandwich! I love spice!!!

Their sandwich is now part of my top 3 for the best sandwich I've had so far. I ordered the Carter and it included hot turkey, avocado, bacon, bomb sauce and cream cheese. They also include mayo, secret sauce, lettuce, tomato, onions and peppers. I took out the pickles and mustard. I think I would've liked it better too if I took the peppers out as well. The sandwich as a whole was delicious regardless! You must try the Dutch Crunch as your bread. It was one of my favorite part of the sandwich. The quality of the ingredients were good including the fresh avocados. The portion was decent and filling.

The workers are so nice! The guy that took my order was very thorough on explaining the sandwiches and the ingredients to me. He was very patient as I asked a million questions since it was my first time. Another worker checked up on us while we were eating too. It was a pleasant experience as a first timer. The simple cute decor is a plus. I will definitely be coming back if I'm around the area.

I feel bad for giving such a low rating....especially considering everyone seems to love this place but I didn't have that experience.  After seeing all the pics here on Yelp and it's right down the street I decided to give The Sandwich Spot a whirl.  I couldn't wait to try.  Looked like such an improvement from the typical Capriotti's, Subway, Jersey Mike's.  What a disappointment.  I got the #1, Italian Stallion.  E got the Winston Cooper of course both on the yummy crunchy bread that I had read so much about.  We get home and I get ready to dive into my sandwich to find it soooo skimpy.  Other people who posted pics must've paid for triple meat and to top it all off I had NO CHEESE.....doesn't the cheese go on first?!?!?!  For almost $19 I will not be back.
The reason for the 3 stars is because the owner was there and was very friendly to us patrons along with the other staff but for me it's not worth the price of admission :(

Got the meatball sandwich. I was impressed. Got meatball to bread ratio. Meatballs were zesty enough without a need for a messy amount of marinara. The Dutch crunch bread was just crunchy enough to add to the sandwich without hurting the roof of my mouth. It was a little bit pricey ($9 for about a 9" sandwich), but I'm ok with spending a little more for good food.
This is a cool place.  Just enough "hole-in-the-wall" to fit my taste.  The sandwich was really good and the service was great as well.

A nice little hidden gem across from my hospital. This is the first time we have ever been here and will definitely be coming back!! Service was excellent and the sandwiches were amazing. The bomb sauce was exactly that and I literally ate my sandwich in 3 seconds flat.

Fist time here and got 2 sandwhiches...They were Fng smal.. For a child.. The pastrami mommy and the tom slick.. Fng bad. Asked for extra meat. LOL. Hardly any meat. Spent almost $20 for both sandwhiches..
Way to over priced. The picture here on this site is fake....Will never go back and will not refer others...Fng bad spot...

This place is second to none. Hands down the best sandwich I've ever had in my life! The first time I had it was a couple of days ago and then I went again yesterday and now my wife and I are going there tonight for a date night! That's how amazing these sandwiches are! It's definitely a work of art! And the prices are awesome for what you get. The sourdough is to die for and its made fresh to order! If you love sourdough from San Francisco, this is the place that replicates their sourdough perfectly! The workers there are amazing at what they do and are super nice. I'm stoked that I've finally found the best sandwich shop in Vegas! This is a must try, I urge everyone to try it at least once, because you'll definitely be hooked!!

Great little place.  I had the carter on Dutch crunch bread and it was very good. 

I will be back.

SO EXCITED I FOUND THIS PLACE IN LAS VEGAS!

I am originally from Sacramento, CA and this place is a city treasure! They have the best sandwiches, the most amazing customer service, and I love that the food is so fresh!

My friend and I did not have a hard time locating the restaurant (its in a strip mall, next to target and off the 95 south freeway), and when we entered we were immediately greeted and asked if we had visited before. We remarked that we used to frequent this place in California, and the cashier immediately began to walk us through the menu and the types of sandwiches. While the menu was different from Sacramento, the food was still amazing. I ordered the spicy chick and it was spicy, filling, and very fresh! I had so much left that I needed a bag, and the sandwich artist expertly wrapped it up for me. Will definitely be visiting again!

WOW WOW WOW! The sandwiches here are AWESOME! My new favorite! And the Dutch crunch roll is a must! I also had their wheat sliced bread and that was fresh and delicious. I feel like you really can't go wrong with anything on their menu. I'm anxious to try it all!

We were very exited to try this place as my bf is a sandwich fanatic!  They have an extensive menu which makes it difficult to make a quick decision, but at the same time you will find something you like. I felt that the quality of the ingredients were very fresh and tasty. I liked the fact that they took the time to explain their popular items. You can choose the type of bread and cheese in every sandwich. They all come with the standard onions, letters, tomatoes, mayo, pickles, salt and pepper in addition to the flavor you picked. We ordered the Carter and the Spartan. Both were very fresh and delish. The spartan was very juicy, which I enjoyed a lot. The decor and uthe atmosphere are pretty hip, even though the place is so small. I would recommend this place for a quick lunch.
D-lish! Great sandwich spot. The Dutch Bread is amazing and the meat used tastes great! Can't wait to try all the different kinds of sandwiches!
Amazing!!! Finally a good sandwich shop in Vegas:) The Dutch crunch bread and Bomb sauce are a big must!! I will be back tomorrow!!!

Easily a five star lunch. I had the Winston Cooper with pepper jack on a Dutch crunch roll. Amazing. While not the meatiest (pause) sandwich I've ever had, the flavors more than make up for it. This place definitely isn't Subway or Port of Subs. The menu is full of creative, original artisan sandwiches.

The Winston Cooper is $8.49, but you can make it a combo (sandwich/chips/soda) for only $1 more. No brainer at that price. A fresh, filling lunch for $9.49 plus tax. Count me as a fan.

The mood "Sandwich".. The goal, accomplished. I'm all about the whole experience. Never been in here and was greeted with great customer service. The menu was deff a treat for the eyes, as you dnt know what one to pick, but you must choose. The lady helping us didn't rush me, gave me suggestions. I'm stoked about what she offered.  Great for kids too, their chalk wall can keep the little ones occupied. Very laid back and awesome AF
Friendly, clean, excellent service, very good sandwiches, yummy macaroni salad. Will be back for sure.
This is by FAR the most delicious sandwich I have ever had. The double crunch bread is AMAZING! Do yourself a favor and have this for lunch!

This was my first time, I haven't tried all the sandwiches yet, BUT I did try the hot turkey sandwich with everything on it. The best part was the wonderful lady at the counter who poured all 3 sauces on the side for me to try. That was SO sweet! Let me just say, hell yes, I want to buy that psycho sauce and put it on everything. I wouldn't have tried it without her offering it and now I'm addicted. Thank you! Best addiction ever! I can't wait to go back and try everything on that list

The Dutch crunch rolls are keeping me coming back for more. The bread is the absolute best part of any sandwich I've had there, but they do have some unique flavor combinations. The sandwiches are a step up from Subway but the staff leaves a bit to be desired. 

 For a mom and pop place they should be friendlier and greet everyone with a smile. If I want attitude I will ask my teenager to make me a sandwich. And enough with the bomb sauce, I'm not 3 and I don't want my food covered in a ranch based sauce.
I love this place. Food is fresh. Love the specialty bread they use. It is oh so good!

DUTCH CRUNCH BREAD - enough said.  I have never had this bread before and believe me I will be back next time I'm visiting Vegas to have more.  I had the Grace Lucia and would get it again.  It was spicy and delicious.  I also had a side of macaroni salad that was just so-so (I'm spoiled by my mom's macaroni salad), but don't let that keep you away.

I ordered All American on wheat and my husband ordered Winston Cooper; bread is great, m√©ats were great and sandwiches were fantastic.  Restaurant is Tiny for dining our but dont let that stop you.  Combo with drink is less than $10.

The MOAS (Mother of All Sandwiches). Seriously, folks, this is a keeper. I ate at the Palm Springs location a couple years ago and was stoked to learn a few months ago that they are now in Vegas. The #12 Winston Cooper owns my heart, but you can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches offered. The Dutch crunch bread and bomb sauce keep me up at night thinking about sandwiches. Can't get enough.

Never noticed this place till I got an email from Yelp saying I should check it out. It was every bit as good as the reviews suggested. Very friendly and helpful staff, and also like some other reviewers noted, not exactly speedy. Got a #16 for my husband and a salad with tuna for me. Both of us were very happy.
Dutch Crunch bread is amazing!!! Had the Italian Stallion and it was excellent. Staff is friendly. Good sub place!!!

Found this awesome little joint while we were in Las Vegas with the kids. Awesome sandwiches! All four of us loved them and they are right on about the Dutch bread... SO good!!! Would eat here all the time if we lived here but it will just have to be a fond memory for us! Yum!!!
The place was very good. High quality ingredients and lots of options. Great grilled cheese for the kids. Crunch bread was very yummy.

Sandwich Shop Located here in Las Vegas NV. Was Pretty Good!

After reading many great reviews on my Yelp I knew we had to come give this place a try. I'm glad we did. :)

Employees Were Friendly and the Service Was Fantastic!

Sandwiches Were Really Good and Exactly As  Ordered!

Salad Was Fresh and Extremely Filling!

Food Was Delicious!

  I Recommend Giving The Sandwich Place A Try. 

 It's A Great Little Business. :)
If you're looking for an amazing sandwhich, THIS is the spot. Service is great! Sandwiches are phenomenal and a lot of variety.

Our office ordered five sandwiches from this restaurant and everyone enjoyed their sandwiches thoroughly! I personally got the hot turkey sandwich with bacon cheddar cheese and avocado. (2)  It was delicious. I will definitely go back to the Sandwich Spot!!
The sandwiches are a little messy but soooo good. The Dutch crunch bread and psycho and bomb sauces are everything.

The first sandwich shop I've been to in Vegas since we moved here 2 years ago that actually has true sourdough sandwich rolls! Being from the San Francisco area, we were used to great, dense sourdough bread for our deli sandwiches. Here in Vegas it seems hard to come by... will definitely be coming back for more!

I love this place. Every sandwich I've had has been delicious and the ownership seriously cares about making a good sandwich. My immediate thought was how do I get work pay for catering at this place. 

Go there, spend under ten bucks get a whole meal and stop bitching about stuff and enjoy a good sandwich.
This place was awesome! I came here due to the great yelp reviews and they surely did not disappoint. I definitely recommend coming here.

Awesome Place! I always get the Darius add full turkey, both toasted, brown mustard on the side. It's like crack lol. Sooooo good. You will realize subway and port o subs etc... suck in comparison. Call in your order because a good sandwich takes a bit longer.
My favorite sandwich shop in Vegas. Just don't go there in a rush. It's not fast like Jimmy John's, but totally worth the wait.

Had lunch here with my daughter today, we were driving by and saw the place and thought we would give it a try. We both enjoyed our sandwiches, and got a good laugh at the girls conversation behind the counter. Their taste in music not so enjoyable!

They have a great menu - lots of specialty sandwiches to choose from. I've been twice already and really enjoyed both of my sandwiches (The Carter and Miss Swiss). 

The sliced marble rye is really good! And their bomb sauce, a jalape√±o ranch sauce, is great on the sandwich or on the side for dipping. The sandwiches are pretty big too. 

The last time I went was for lunch, and it took a little bit to make my sandwich, even without anyone in front of me - next time I'll phone it in. I also think they'll get faster as they learn the menu and get some practice the longer they're open. In all, a great new sandwich place that you should definitely try!

Not sure why this place has such great reviews. Aside from having this nasty brown lettuce and long blonde hair in my sandwich, I guess the sandwich was mediocre, not any better than any pre-made sandwich that you can get at the grocery store. It's not like they have freshly baked bread or freshly sliced meats, I'm not sure what the hype is. 

Stars for friendly staff, cute atmosphere, and a pretty interesting menu.

This is my new favorite sandwich place! Really friendly staff and cool atmosphere for the small space.  I love the sign art on the walls. The menu was loaded with tons of great choices. I ordered the spartan on sourdough. Bread was absolutely amazing. It was fresh and really held everything together. The sandwich was delicious. It had a sauce on it that was very flavorful. Everything from the avocados to the tomatoes were extremely fresh. My fianc√© ordered the Winston cooper. The meats were nicely sliced and tasted great together with everything on it.

The Sandwich Spot was a great, local small business to grab a bite to eat!

The bread was delicious and my sandwich was fantastic! I had the 'Roger That', which was on point!!

The employees were friendly and the place got busy quickly around lunchtime.

Highly recommend The Sandwich Spot!

The bread is fresh and delectable. The bomb sauce isn't so bomb. It's flavorful, but too spicy for me! (I don't think most would think its that spicy). Glad I went, may want to try a different sandwich next time. I got the #16. Whoever thought to put cream cheese on a sandwich is brilliant!

Been here twice now.

The Food is SUPER YUMMY!

In February when I came (first time) I had the #12 on the dutch crunch bread.  It was great!  I took half home!

Today I ordered the #16 on Dutch Crunch.  STILL YUMMY!

Sadly, the customer service leaves a bit to be desired.  If you're greeted with a "hi!" That's a lot.  When you pay it asks you for a tip, but the only tip I could leave was "smile, and make it seem like you're happy to see your customers".

I take reviews serious as I am a business owner myself, and I praise as much as critique.

My last two visits give the food a thumbs up, but the customer service a "needs improvement".

A new sandwich spot. Why not? Who doesn't love sandwiches. With so many different ones to try on the menu I'm sure even the pickiest eaters will find something they like.

I chose the carter which has cream cheese,hot turkey,avacado,bacon & bomb sauce. Mr P had the Winston Cooper which had hot pastrami,salami,roast beef and pepper jack. They both came with lettuce, tomato,onion,peppers,pickles and mustard. We both opted out of mustard and pickles. We both had it on Dutch crunch bread. The dutch crunch has a buttered top. The top of the bread almost looks cracked from when the butter bakes into the bread. They also have sourdough and wheat. 

The sandwiches themselves were loaded with toppings. They didn't skimp at all. I felt like the bomb sauce just didn't stand out. Maybe the cream cheese overpowered it. Next time I will order the sauces on the side to try. We both enjoyed our sandwiches and had leftovers. 

My guy hand delivered my sandwich so I have yet to visit the shop. When I do I will update my review.

Yeah, Sandwich Spot.  Yeah. 
I came here just for another quick praise. 

This place seriously is the best sandwich place in town.  (In my humble opinion).

Time after time we've come here and send other people here -- it NEVER disappoints.  Never. 

Each time, I try REALLY hard to try new things.  But, I always resort back to my fav - the Pastrami Mommy with everything on it.  Which I probably should get it without banana peppers because I always take them off anyways.  And ALWAYS get the Dutch Crutch bread.  If you don't, you'll regret it for the rest of your life.  Even if it sounds funky, it's not.  It's the best party you'll ever have in your mouth. 

That is all.

Italian stallion is combination of fresh meats sliced to perfection and with the the right amount of veggies. If taking to go get it dry and it will be perfect for a road trip or a great hike at the mountain. Shop is right off the freeway and fast service for a fresh sandwich. Oh wait the Dutch crunch bread would never have done if not recommended. Fantastic so try it!

Cool little sandwich spot . All kinds of different sandwiches and good bread. Only thing i didnt like ive been there a few times and the lady workers are not very friendly and kindda smells weird so i dont eat inside.. Its probably the different meats but they should open the door or a window for ventilation. Also it would be great if they had soup and not just chips.id give it a 4 but the service and smell its a 3

This actually deserves zero stars but i am giving it one star just so I can write a review. Both sandwiches we ordered were the worst sandwiches we have eaten. Bread was stale, meat was gross, and overall sandwich was inedible. We both ended up taking 2 bites and throwing the almost the rest away. The service took really long and it was over $18 for two nasty sandwiches.
Beat sandwich spot around!!! Comparable to all others and very friendly staff. Love this place

Pretty much my go to sandwich spot from now on. This place is as solid as it gets.

Finding the place as well as finding parking is relatively easy. Right when you come in you're greeted and from there you order what you want. I choose the carter which was pretty good. The mixture of ingredients with the bomb sauce was nice. But what really stood out was my friends sandwich she had the Miss Swiss: hot turkey, prosciutto, avocada and swiss cheese BUT she also added cranberry. Which for some reason made it the best sandwich I have ever tasted. It'll probably be my staple from now on.

The layout of the place is pretty simple. They have this huge photogenic sign with a cool dimly lit hallway. 

Customer service here was very pleasant. They're super willing to explain everything to you and will try to find a sandwich that will fit your taste. Sometimes it takes awhile for the food to come out, but they just opened so I can't blame them for that. 

If possible I would give this place 6 stars, but too bad I'm limited to 5 :))

Not sure what magic they put in the sandwiches, but I have to convince myself not to eat there EVERY day. I refrain long enough to only go once or twice a week. I've now tried three different sandwiches, each better than the rest. Seriously good.
Super rad place, Tony and Bri were super awesome and were totally accommodating and very, very friendly. TOTALLY coming back!

I've been hoping that a sandwich place in town would have Dutch crunch! By far one of the best breads of all time to make a sammy with. A little sweet, crunchy and fluffy in the middle. Service was friendly and the food came out fast.

As for the sandwiches, they have a lot of similar selections but the two we got were excellent. Get "everything", great pickles and a nice sauce. Number 2 and 16. Most popular.
Only problem is that it's very far away from Henderson, wish it was closer!

5 star sandwich, best in town in my opinion so far.

I've ordered here twice through Uber Eats. And I can't get enough! Their sandwiches are completely original and different than ones that you find everywhere else their ingredients are fresh their bread is amazing. Try the  psycho sauce and bomber sauce, you can't lose. And I know it won't resonate with most people but I can't find alfalfa sprouts anymore in Vegas but they have them!!!
What can I say about The Sandwich Spot?  I've been here with my wife a few times and they have produced great sandwiches!  I recommend it highly.
Delicious sandwiches. The food was fresh and tasty with a great sandwich menu. The staff is friendly and helpful. The place is clean and cute.
The bread makes the sandwiches. Their sour dough is the best!  Dutch crunch is good too!  Great lunch spot!

I'm SO elated to have this delicious sandwich chain in Northwest Las Vegas. I've come to the realization that it is humanly impossible to order a bad sandwich here. 

My personal favorite sandwich is their vegetarian sandwich which has alfalfa sprouts, avocado, cucumbers, onions, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, cheese, bomb sauce and cream cheese on their signature Dutch Crunch bread. Their roast beef sandwich with cream cheese is delightful too, but I'm not sure if that is an actual sandwich on the menu. They will customize any sandwich on the menu to meet your specifications just because they care about the customer experience. At the Sandwich Spot, you can taste the love in each and every bite.

The only negative thing I have to say about The Sandwich Spot is the amount of time it takes to make a sandwich.  On my first visit, I was the only person there and it took nearly 20 minutes to make two sandwiches. I thought about hoping over the counter and giving them a hand, but they had it under control. This week, I came in during the lunchtime rush and it took more than 30 minutes before my two sandwiches were ready. 

Helpful hint: Call ahead and make it a meal with chips & a drink for a buck more.

I love this place!!! 
I'm gluten sensitive and I never have issues here. The sandwiches are incredibly good.  I've probably eaten all of them at some point.  I also like the family friendly environment.  Great chalk wall for kids to draw on. My son has autism and this is one of the few places I can bring him.

Just went to the S Spot! I had the Italian Stallion and it was really good! Alissa made it for me. She and the guy working the register was nothing but helpful and really nice! I read an evaluation saying they weren't nice etc. baloney! Pardon the sandwich pun!
Great sandwiches! Not the best location and the wait can be long, so definitely call ahead or order online. The Dutch crunch bread is amazing!

Ok.  I had to wait for what seemed like a long time, 20 minutes maybe?  However it was the best sandwich I've ever had.  My group of 4 from
Out of town, all enjoyed ours.  I had a turkey avocado bacon sandwich on their crunchy rice bread.
So yummy!!

My friend and I decided to stop by here for lunch since we were heading out to the SoBe arena at Fiesta Rancho for some ice skating. Plus, it's a brand new establishment -- they had just opened up on Monday! 

We got to talk to the owner of the store for a little bit so we got some info and back story. They had originally opened in Sacramento and have been growing at a really good pace the past few years. They actually have a decent amount of stores in the Bay Area. I thought it was a little odd since I am from the Bay Area and I haven't really heard of them .. but that's probably because they were still new when I was still living there. One of the perks is that the store is completely his own so he doesn't have to name the sandwiches the same as all the other stores ... interesting fact. 

Their menu is quite extensive and has a whole lot of choices for you to choose from. I actually looked at their menu online before I went so I wouldn't be standing there for like 15 minutes deciding what I want to eat... but I did take my time looking at the list of ingredients they add to every sandwich...

I decided to get a #2 The Roger That, which had hot turkey, bacon, avocado, and cheddar cheese. However, I asked them to sub the cheddar cheese with provolone. Every sandwich comes with mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomatoes, secret sauce, pickles, peppers, and onions.... to which I opted the mustard out. 

My friend, on the other hand, went with a #19 The Miss Swiss, which had hot turkey, prosciutto, avocado, and swiss cheese. He opted the mustard, pickles, and peppers out of his sandwich. 

They also have, I believe, three different types of breads to choose from: the usual white, the wheat, sourdough, and a dutch crunch. The dutch crunch is a butter top crust (?) -- little crunchy on the outside while warm and soft on the inside. It's actually a popular type of bread back in the Bay Area so that is a plus. I've never had this type of bread anywhere in Las Vegas before and that's why we chose it today for our sandwiches. 

Also, you can make your sandwich a combo, adding chips and a 22oz drink all for $9.49, which was only a dollar more than our sandwich .. which was a pretty good deal to me so we both turned it into a combo. 

When our sandwiches came out, I was quite impressed. It was a pretty good size and on top of that, there was a lot of turkey in the sandwich. I couldn't help myself and just started munching on my sandwich without a word. Football was also playing on their TV so that was a nice plus too! 

Oh the owner also gave us a little bit of their psycho sauce and bomb sauce to try out :D the psycho sauce was pretty sweet, almost like a bbq sauce. The bomb sauce, which was a jalapeno ranch sauce is pretty good but a little too heavy. I can tell that if I have too much of it, it'd be too much for me to handle. 

BUT yummy in my tummy. The sandwich was delicious. The best part about the sandwich is that they do not skimp on the ingredients at all. There were plenty of pickles and peppers. Not too much onions, which was actually PERFECT cause I don't like TOO much onions in my sandwich. The bread was really delicious too, it tasted fresh and the crunch on the top added a really good texture too. Though, the thing I did notice is that my sandwich was dripping water...probably from the pickles and the peppers perhaps? I don't know. I may also opt out of the peppers and pickles next time or have them go light .. cause I did notice that it covered up a lot of the turkey taste :( ...

And I only finished half of the sandwich and my chips ... I took the other half home. TOO MUCH FOOD. 

Overall, quality ingredients, great bread, good amount of food, price wise is great for what they serve you, and service is really friendly. 

The only down side is ... it is quite far from where I live. If we weren't going to the SoBe arena for ice skating, we probably wouldn't even be on this side of town. I live on the SE side of town while my friend lived on the SW side of town .. so getting to this location is longer than your usual lunch commute in Las Vegas. I mean, if I lived closer, I would definitely come back more often ...but since I don't, I'm not sure how often I would be able to go. Now don't get me wrong, the food is great and the price is great but I'm not sure if it warrants the drive.

We have talked to the owner a little about the location. He mentioned that he originally looked for a place in the SW area but it didn't really work out. But it is still in the back of his mind .. who knows, maybe he'll decide to move closer ! 

But, if you're in the area, give it a try. Definitely worth.
Dutch crunch in my faaaaace. Soothes my Northern Californian soul. Try the Swiss Miss.

Definitely love this place, I usually get the Hot Carter sandwich (although I remove Avocado). Their bomb sauce is well... bomb! Potato salad is very good, and that's hard to come by for lunch places. Every time I come here the food is tasty, delivery is quick, and the person answering the phone is always polite. My only complaint is they close pretty early. 7pm stopped me from getting this place for dinner last night, bummed =\
Will definitely return to try other sandwiches. Great customer service and food so  I love the location it wasn't hard to find looking forward to hopefully seeing more shops around Las Vegas Valley.

Wow! This is a sandwich shop.  Like back in the '70s and '80s in San Francisco.  
It's true what the other reviews are saying.  I choose to have marble rye bread and it was superb.  #2 with marble rye.

Good Sandwiches at fair prices.  The biggest thing that I have a challenge with is the names of an item that tell you nothing about it, forcing you to read the entire description to determine if you want it.

They have a a price "happy hour" from 2-4.

Very first time coming here, there were so many options. My boyfriend and I tried the  Binnion's Baller, meatball sub type sandwich and what really made this stand out was the Bomb Sauce. The Italian Stallion is fresh and  the Prosciutto is PERFECT (not too salty and it doesn't overpower the salami or ham). The prices are great too for the quality. Not more than $9.

I am going to come back to try everything else on this Menu but what really made me enjoy this place was the service, they took the time to suggest additions to add to the sandwich pop such as the Secret Sauce.

Great service, great food, great prices!

These are not ordinary sandwiches! The combinations are so good! I'm weight conscious so I usually get the Darius which has no meat and lots of veggies. The people that work here are so friendly. We get texts that give us specials like a dollar off.

Fabulous variety for any sandwich lover ! I especially  love the darius sandwich its loaded with generous portion of veggies. I am gluten free so its great to be able to order any sandwich made on gluten free bread. The employees are very friendly and make everything with care.
Can't count the number of delicious sandwiches that I have bought here in the past few months.  Love the Dutch Crunch rolls can't find the sandwiches here or of any similar quality anywhere in Vegas

This place didn't exactly blow my skirt up...

I had the Italian sandwich on the dutch crunch bread.  The Dutch crunch bread tasted good, but it scraped up the roof of my mouth - ouch!  I don't know how anyone can eat that and put yourself through the pain while eating a sandwich.  When it comes to sandwiches the bread is super important...

The rest of the sandwich was ok, not great.  It had some fairly average deli meat on it.  It was not a very big sandwich either.  It was almost all bread with a modest portion of meat and toppings in the middle.  Not bad - but far from excellent.

I would go back to try another sandwich.  The 2 star review is basically what it is supposed to represent - "meh. Ive experienced better."  3 stars means A-ok and my experience wasn't that.  I really wish there was a star value for average or just OK.

CANT GO WRONG HERE!

Listen, eat here. This place is amazing. They get it right.

Try the bomb sauce, get any sandwich. My favorite is the Dutch crunch. It's all good. 

Every place else is Ghostbusters 16' and the Sandwich Shop is Ghostbusters 84'. Plain and simple.

Let me first say, I love avocados as much as anyone, but I ordered the Swiss Miss and  it was MUCH more avocado heavy than I thought. There was barely any Swiss cheese, so it didn't really do the name justice. The sandwich was good, not great. Redeemable: I love a great Dutch crunch bread and this place really knows how to make a good Dutch crunch!
The owner is very nice and the sandwiches are on point ! This place is has amazing sandwiches!

Hard to imagine that you can't find something you like at The Sandwich Spot, with all of the specialty sandwiches and a myriad of bread combinations + the extras. Takes longer to prepare but it's worth it. With the Spot in my hood, haven't visited the massive chain sub way joints for many moons.

Delicious is the first thought I had.  It takes several minutes to get your sandwich and it is worth the wait for the fresh warm delight.
The Dutch bread was a nice option and the turkey bacon and avocado will be my choice again next visit.
First time here. Got the  pastrami with everything on the Dutch crunch and it is super delish. Nice atmosphere. Not crowded at all during lunch.

Stopped by the sandwich shop after a nice hike with my brother and we loved it, taste just like the sandwiches back home (Napa valley) I now drive from Henderson once a month for a sandwich. Yup their that good :)

Nice to have a different sandwich place in the neighborhood with quality ingredients, great service and decent prices.  Prepared both hot and cold with unique breads and spreads this is the real deal insofar as meats and cheeses which are delicious.  I like their turkey sandwiches as well as their beef varieties.  Good pastrami and salami.  Come with an appetite because these are big sandwiches.  Could offer alternative breads for the gluten-free crowd and a vegetarian option like Jimmy Johns.

Delicious sandwiches!! Really good service and a friendly conversations to go along with it. I really like the franchise concept that no two shops look alike, so each owner can have something that truly feels like their own.

Recommended as a regular "spot" for sandwiches :-)

Tried this spot for the first time after all the excellent yelp reviews, I ordered The Carter on dutch crunch bread and it was delicious, Service was fast and friendly and the prices are reasonable, Looking forward to coming back again soon and trying something different.

So we tried it for the frist time today, and omg it was delicious. I got the hot pastrami with the salami and I added avocado best sandwich. I highly recommend this place for anyone lookimg for a nice lunch

This place is just like Ike's and Ike's is awesome. 

Dutch crunch and any of the sauces will do you right.

Nice little sandwich shop located in the Target shopping area off Cheyenne and Tenaya. Very clean and modern inside, with friendly service.

My rating would be more like 3.6 stars rounded up to 4. One thing I found very strange looking at the menu was a lack of ham based sandwiches. I am a ham sandwich kind of guy, and they offered nothing ham except the build your own sandwich. Plenty of turkey, plenty of chicken, plenty of roast beef....but no ham combinations. 

I ordered the Carter, which is Turkey, avocado, bacon, bomb sauce, and cream cheese. I didn't quite taste any bacon so maybe adding more here would help. You do get your choice of extras like lettuce, tomatoes, mayo etc....so its built to your taste. $8.49 for the sandwich, and an extra $1 gets you chips and a drink.
I had mine on the Dutch crunch bread which, while interesting, is really just white bread and a crunchy like outer shell. 

Overall, a much better sandwich than Subway, Quizno's, or any of the other chain places. Really wish they had ham choices though.
I may have to make this my weekly sandwich spot. Reuben was delicious and the potato salad is the best I've ever had. So many choices as well. Inside is very clean and nicely decorated.

Soo bomb!!!  You must try!!! I was blown out of the waters with my sandwich.  The staff helped me craft my very own #12 with secret sauce.  When my girlfriend and I  took our first bite we both had the ah ha look.  

They loaded the sandwich up!  If you're a foot long eater you're gonna get filled up with just half of the sandwich. 

The location is right next to target.  It's a super low key,  super laid back atmosphere, and the staff are great.  

This is that "secret sandwich shop" that you always wanna brag about.  Seriously.

The sandwiches only come in one size , but they're stacked fat with the delicious meaty awesomeness. Lots of veggies, cheese and anything else you want to. The staff are attentive, helpful and great at what they do.  Double thumbs up.
I'm deeply saddened this placed closed it was hands down the absolute best sandwich shop in the entire city!!!!!

Came here with my son. Great sandwiches! There was a group of 10 ahead of me I almost left but so glad that I waited!! Great sauces and creative ideas I will def be back. Thank you yelp for the recommendation:)

I had the Tom Slick on the Dutch Crunch bread. What a delicious sandwich! The bomb sauce is really that- the bomb. I kept hearing about this wonderful dutch crunch bread. It was worth the wait.  I can't wait to go back and try another.

This place is so good! Everyone on here was raving about the "Winston Cooper" on Dutch Crunch. I had to try it! With all their secret sauces. Counter gents are pretty cool. Unfortunately, this place will be renamed. They say the menu, sauces, and rock music won't, just the name and maybe the atmosphere. Let's hope it stays that way  IMO, this is the "Dirt Dog" of sandwiches  and yes they are California based hence my quote. The Psycho sauce is amazing as fuck on the sandwich. I put a small amount for each bite. Go here and get awesome grub!

This place is convenient for my boyfriend and I. My boyfriend loves this place. I'm not usually a sandwich goer, but today I decided to try and order from them through yelp. Since it was my first order through yelp, I hit the submit button with a little too much quickness. When arriving at the restaurant, they asked if I was finished ordering... I said it was my first time trying it and I wasn't sure if I completed my order... They included the section I overlooked which were the toppings like pickles and mayonnaise and mustard. They could have let me leave and I would have been disappointed with no mayo or mustard. I thought it was GREAT that they informed me, and included what I overlooked/forgot. Next time I'll be a bit more careful when ordering! Thanks Sandwich Spot! :)

Holy cow, that was one heck of a deeeeeeeelicious sandwich. Random stop proved well worth it. There is a readon their rating is soooo high! The Winston.. WOW!!!!! Reasonably priced and filling, generously filling at that!

Check this place out when you're in the NW area for lunch or near Mountain view hospital and want to try something different.

They have uniquely named sandwiches and you have to have it on the Dutch crunch bread. It's worth the extra money to have one of their sandwiches compared to other places, it isn't a huge portion but makes up for it in taste. I recommend the bomb sauce on your sandwich depending on which one you build or select off their diverse menu.

Been to this location multiple times and I'm surprised I haven't reviewed it yet!! They probably have the best sandwich I've ever eaten. (I think Babe would also say the same thing for him.) I mean, I fell in love at first bite. I never knew how delicious a sandwich could really be. Their ingredients are fresh and you can tell everything is made to order. The sauces are delicious. The atmosphere is great. And the service is even better! You can call ahead and order for pick up or come in (if you have some time cause they can be fairly busy) and enjoy your freshly made sandwich in house. You can upgrade to a meal and they have sides to choose from. I personally like sea salt chips with my sandwiches but that's just me. Babe and I would definitely recommend this spot!!
They have a location in Simi Valley California and it's just as delicious! Forget subway or another "fast food" sandwich chain and come here!

I couldn't resist trying The Sandwich Spot after hearing they had just opened up. 

It's located in an obscure mini mall. I asked for some advice on what to order since I was a bit overwhelmed with choices and the guy behind the counter suggested the Carter. I was a little wary about cream cheese on a sandwich, but figured I'd give it a shot and I opted for the Dutch crunch bread. 

I got my sandwich quickly and was out the door. I arrived just before the lunch rush as the line built up quite a bit when I was leaving.

I enjoyed my sandwich, but I have to say that I'm glad I tried it as it was on the menu but I didn't love the cream cheese and the bomb sauce didn't have as much kick as I would have liked. The bread was good and the rest of the ingredients were tasty, but there wasn't enough about my meal to make me go out of my way to return. 

This is a sandwich shop when you're in the area and the prices were good.
